Radiology (MBBS)

Radiology is the medical specialty that uses imaging techniques to diagnose and treat diseases within the body. Radiologists interpret various types of scans and images, such as X-rays, CT scans, MRI scans, and ultrasound, to assist in the diagnosis and management of medical conditions.

Semester 1

Semester 1 Subjects:

The first semester introduces the fundamentals of radiology and basic imaging techniques.

    Introduction to Radiology: Overview of the field, including basic principles and types of imaging modalities.

    Basic Imaging Techniques: Study of X-rays, CT scans, and MRI basics.

    Radiation Physics: Understanding the physics of radiation used in imaging.

    Radiation Safety: Principles and practices to ensure safety in radiological procedures.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Essentials of Radiology by Fred A. Mettler Jr.

    Introduction to Radiologic Technology by Bruce W. Long

YouTube Channels for Semester 1 Subjects:

    English: Radiology Channel

    Hindi: Dr. Najeeb Lectures

Semester 2

Semester 2 Subjects:

The second semester builds on basic concepts and covers more detailed imaging techniques and diagnostic methods.

    Advanced Imaging Techniques: Detailed study of CT, MRI, and ultrasound imaging.

    Radiographic Anatomy: Understanding the anatomy as seen through various imaging modalities.

    Contrast Media: Use of contrast agents in imaging studies.

    Imaging of Common Diseases: Application of imaging techniques in diagnosing common diseases.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Fundamentals of Diagnostic Radiology by William E. Brant

    Diagnostic Radiology: Physics and Technology by Peter D. W. Johnson

YouTube Channels for Semester 2 Subjects:

    English: Radiology Channel

    Hindi: Dr. Najeeb Lectures

Semester 3

Semester 3 Subjects:

The third semester involves practical applications and advanced topics in radiology.

    Clinical Radiology: Practical application of radiology in clinical settings.

    Interventional Radiology: Techniques and procedures for minimally invasive interventions.

    Imaging of Trauma: Use of imaging in trauma cases and emergency situations.

    Pediatric Radiology: Imaging considerations and techniques specific to pediatric patients.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Diagnostic Imaging: Chest by Melissa L. Rosado de Christenson

    Clinical Pediatric Radiology by Mary M. Goss

YouTube Channels for Semester 3 Subjects:

    English: Radiology Channel

    Hindi: Dr. Najeeb Lectures

Semester 4

Semester 4 Subjects:

The fourth semester includes advanced radiology topics and clinical skills development.

    Advanced MRI Techniques: In-depth study of advanced MRI techniques and applications.

    Advanced CT Imaging: Techniques and advancements in CT imaging.

    Radiology in Oncology: Role of radiology in the diagnosis and management of cancer.

    Ethics and Patient Care in Radiology: Ethical considerations and patient care in radiology.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Essentials of Radiology: A Case-Based Approach by Ronald L. Eisenberg

    Oncological Imaging by Carol M. Rumack

YouTube Channels for Semester 4 Subjects:

    English: Radiology Channel

    Hindi: Dr. Najeeb Lectures

Semester 5

Semester 5 Subjects:

The fifth semester focuses on integrating knowledge and preparing for practical exams.

    Integrated Radiology Practice: Combining various imaging modalities in clinical practice.

    Case Studies and Clinical Presentations: Detailed case studies and presentations of radiological findings.

    Preparation for Practical Exams: Strategies and practice for practical radiology exams.

    Review of Radiological Protocols: Understanding and application of standard radiological protocols.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Radiology Review Manual by William Herring

    Practical Radiology: An Introduction to the Techniques and Applications by Michael C. Leung

YouTube Channels for Semester 5 Subjects:

    English: Radiology Channel

    Hindi: Dr. Najeeb Lectures

Semester 6

Semester 6 Subjects:

The sixth semester emphasizes advanced clinical rotations and specialized radiology topics.

    Advanced Clinical Rotations: Specialized rotations focusing on complex radiological cases.

    Radiology in Special Populations: Imaging considerations for different patient populations, including elderly and pregnant patients.

    Research in Radiology: Overview of current research and methodologies in the field.

    Integration of Radiology with Other Specialties: Role of radiology in multidisciplinary care.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Fundamentals of Radiology by William Herring

    Clinical Radiology: The Essentials by W. Richard Webb

YouTube Channels for Semester 6 Subjects:

    English: Radiology Channel

    Hindi: Dr. Najeeb Lectures

Semester 7

Semester 7 Subjects:

The seventh semester focuses on clinical practice, advanced imaging techniques, and preparation for exams.

    Advanced Imaging Techniques: Study of the latest advancements in imaging technology.

    Clinical Case Presentations: Presentation and discussion of advanced clinical cases.

    Preparation for Final Exams: Comprehensive review and strategies for final exams.

    Career Planning: Guidance on career paths, further specialization, and fellowship opportunities.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Radiology Secrets by Peter D. L. Allen

    Comprehensive Radiology: A Case-Based Approach by Richard E. H. Smith

YouTube Channels for Semester 7 Subjects:

    English: Radiology Channel

    Hindi: Dr. Najeeb Lectures

Semester 8

Semester 8 Subjects:

The eighth semester focuses on final preparations for exams and professional development.

    Final Clinical Rotations: Final rotations to consolidate radiology skills and knowledge.

    Preparation for Final Exams: Comprehensive review strategies for final exams, including practical and theoretical assessments.

    Professional Development: Skills and strategies for transitioning to professional practice in radiology.

    Career Opportunities: Exploration of career paths, fellowship opportunities, and further specialization.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Radiology for Medical Students by L. L. L. Miller

    Advanced Diagnostic Imaging by Ronald L. Eisenberg

YouTube Channels for Semester 8 Subjects:

    English: Radiology Channel

    Hindi: Dr. Najeeb Lectures

Semester 9

Semester 9 Subjects:

The ninth semester involves extensive clinical practice and preparation for professional transition.

    Final Clinical Rotations: Comprehensive rotations focusing on applying radiology skills and knowledge in real-world settings.

    Preparation for Professional Practice: Final preparation for transitioning from medical school to clinical practice, including practical exams and case studies.

    Ethical and Legal Considerations: Final preparation on ethical and legal aspects of radiology practice.

    Career Planning: Guidance on career pathways, fellowships, and subspecialty training in radiology.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Advanced Radiology: Clinical Practice by John C. Koo

    Professional Development in Radiology by Margaret J. Smith

YouTube Channels for Semester 9 Subjects:

    English: Radiology Channel

    Hindi: Dr. Najeeb Lectures

Future Paths

    Radiologist: Diagnose and interpret medical images to guide patient treatment.

    Interventional Radiologist: Perform minimally invasive procedures guided by imaging techniques.

    Pediatric Radiologist: Specialize in imaging and diagnosing conditions in children.

    Neuroradiologist: Focus on imaging of the brain and nervous system.

    Oncological Radiologist: Specialize in imaging for cancer diagnosis and management.

Preparation Tips

    Understand Imaging Techniques: Build a strong foundation in various imaging modalities and their applications.

    Gain Hands-On Experience: Participate in clinical rotations and practice interpreting images.

    Stay Updated: Keep abreast of advancements in radiology technology and techniques.

    Prepare for Exams: Review thoroughly for exams, focusing on both theoretical knowledge and practical skills.

    Engage in Research: Involve yourself in research projects to enhance understanding and contribute to the field.

    Back

Bachelor of Design (B.Des) Courses

  • Design Fundamentals
  • Drawing and Sketching
  • 3D Design
  • Interaction Design
  • Digital Design
  • Product Design
  • Graphic Design
  • Motion Graphics
  • Environmental and Spatial Design
  • Fashion Design

Design Fundamentals

Back

Semester 1

Semester 1 Subjects:

In the first semester, you will be introduced to basic design principles, focusing on visual language and creative thinking.

    Introduction to Design: Fundamentals of design, principles of visual composition, and creative processes.

    Design Sketching: Basic sketching techniques, perspective drawing, and object representation.

    Materials and Processes: Understanding materials, textures, and processes used in design.

    Design History: Evolution of design through the ages, notable design movements, and designers.

    Digital Tools for Design: Introduction to basic digital tools like Adobe Photoshop and Illustrator.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Design: The Definitive Visual Guide by DK Publishing

    Sketching: Drawing Techniques for Product Designers by Koos Eissen

    The History of Design by Clive Edwards

YouTube Channels for Semester 1 Subjects:

    English: Design Addict

    Hindi: Tutorials Jedi

Semester 2

Semester 2 Subjects:

In the second semester, you will deepen your knowledge of design principles and apply them to various media.

    Color Theory: Study of color, its application in design, and the psychology of color usage.

    Typography and Visual Communication: Basics of typography, fonts, and their role in design communication.

    3D Design Basics: Introduction to three-dimensional forms, and physical modeling techniques.

    Introduction to Animation: Basics of movement, storytelling, and simple animation techniques.

    Introduction to User Interface Design: UI design principles, wireframing, and prototyping.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Interaction of Color by Josef Albers

    Thinking with Type by Ellen Lupton

    UI is Communication by Everett N. McKay

YouTube Channels for Semester 2 Subjects:

    English: The Futur Academy

    Hindi: Design Baithak

Semester 3

Semester 3 Subjects:

In the third semester, you’ll explore design for physical and digital products, focusing on usability and aesthetics.

    Product Design Fundamentals: Introduction to product design, human-centered design principles, and ergonomics.

    Interaction Design: Basics of user interaction, designing interfaces, and user experience (UX).

    Design Thinking: Creative problem-solving approaches using design thinking methodologies.

    Photography for Designers: Basics of photography, composition, lighting, and post-processing for design projects.

    Design for Sustainability: Sustainable design practices, eco-friendly materials, and ethical design approaches.

Recommended Reference Books:

    The Design of Everyday Things by Don Norman

    Designing for Interaction by Dan Saffer

    Cradle to Cradle: Remaking the Way We Make Things by William McDonough

YouTube Channels for Semester 3 Subjects:

    English: Nielsen Norman Group

    Hindi: Design Thinking Series

Semester 4

Semester 4 Subjects:

In the fourth semester, you will study advanced design topics and focus on digital media and user experiences.

    Advanced 3D Design: Advanced 3D modeling techniques and rendering, with a focus on product visualization.

    Web Design Fundamentals: Introduction to responsive web design, HTML, CSS, and design frameworks.

    Visual Storytelling: Storyboarding, visual narrative techniques, and animation principles for storytelling.

    Human Factors in Design: Understanding user behavior, cognitive psychology, and human-centered design principles.

    Mobile UI/UX Design: Designing user experiences for mobile devices, and app design basics.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Designing Interfaces by Jenifer Tidwell

    Don't Make Me Think by Steve Krug

    Responsive Web Design by Ethan Marcotte

YouTube Channels for Semester 4 Subjects:

    English: Dev Tips for Designers

    Hindi: The Futur Academy

Semester 5

Semester 5 Subjects:

In the fifth semester, you will delve into advanced product design and interface design, focusing on prototypes and user testing.

    Advanced Product Design: Designing complex products, prototyping techniques, and material explorations.

    Interaction Design II: Advanced interaction design concepts, user journey mapping, and interactive prototyping.

    Service Design: Design of services, touchpoints, and customer journey mapping for effective service solutions.

    Portfolio Development: Building a professional design portfolio showcasing your design projects and process.

    Prototyping and User Testing: Rapid prototyping, wireframes, mockups, and conducting user tests for feedback.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Prototyping for Designers by Kathryn McElroy

    Service Design: From Insight to Implementation by Andy Polaine

    Portfolio Design by Harold Linton

YouTube Channels for Semester 5 Subjects:

    English: Prototyping Design

    Hindi: Design Paatshala

Semester 6

Semester 6 Subjects:

In the sixth semester, you will focus on real-world design projects and internships to gain practical experience in the field.

    Capstone Project I: Start a major design project addressing a real-world problem, guided by faculty advisors.

    Design Internship: Engage in a professional internship to gain hands-on experience in design environments.

    Branding and Identity Design: Design logos, brand guidelines, and visual identities for companies and products.

    Motion Graphics: Learn motion design and animation techniques for digital media.

    Design Ethics and Society: Explore the ethical considerations in design, including social impact and responsibility.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Designing Brand Identity by Alina Wheeler

    Ethics in Graphic Design by Graphic Artists Guild

    Motion Graphics: Principles and Practices by Ian Crook

YouTube Channels for Semester 6 Subjects:

    English: Branding Basics

    Hindi: Design Motion Graphics

Semester 7

Semester 7 Subjects:

In the seventh semester, you will focus on refining your capstone project and preparing for entry into the professional design world.

    Capstone Project II: Complete the major design project with a presentation and evaluation by faculty and industry experts.

    Entrepreneurship in Design: Learn the business side of design, including startup creation, freelancing, and intellectual property.

    Design Leadership: Explore leadership roles in design, managing design teams, and guiding creative processes.

    Design Futures: Study emerging trends in design, technology, and how to stay ahead in the evolving design landscape.

    Professional Practice in Design: Prepare for your career with real-world advice on job search, networking, and career development.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Designing Your Life by Bill Burnett and Dave Evans

    Creative Confidence by Tom Kelley

    Entrepreneurship in Design by Michael Beverland

YouTube Channels for Semester 7 Subjects:

    English: Design Careers Academy

    Hindi: Design Ke Rahasya

Semester 8

Semester 8 Subjects:

The eighth semester is dedicated to finalizing your capstone project, participating in internships, and preparing for graduation.

    Final Capstone Presentation: Present your final capstone project to a panel of faculty and industry professionals.

    Advanced Design Internship: Engage in a full-time internship to solidify your experience and industry connections.

    Portfolio and Career Preparation: Finalize your portfolio, resume, and prepare for job interviews or further studies.

    Independent Design Project: Undertake a personal design project, showcasing your unique skills and creativity.

    Design Exhibition: Participate in a design exhibition where your work is showcased to the public and industry leaders.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Portfolio Design by Harold Linton

    Career Development for the Creative Professional by John McWade

    The Independent Design Guide by Laura Houseley

YouTube Channels for Semester 8 Subjects:

    English: Design Exhibition Series

    Hindi: Design Internships Hindi

Future Paths

    Graphic Designer: Develop visual content for branding, advertising, and communication.

    UI/UX Designer: Design user interfaces and experiences for digital products.

    Product Designer: Design physical products, considering aesthetics, functionality, and usability.

    Industrial Designer: Design concepts for manufacturing, focusing on form, function, and usability.

    Interior Designer: Plan and design interior spaces for functionality and aesthetics.

Preparation Tips

    Build a Strong Design Portfolio: Work on various design projects to showcase your skills.

    Master Design Tools: Get proficient with design tools like Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, and CAD software.

    Study Design Trends: Stay updated on the latest design trends and innovations in the industry.

    Participate in Design Competitions: Compete in design contests to gain experience and exposure.

    Get Real-World Experience: Take up internships or freelance projects to apply your design skills in real-world scenarios.

    Back

Drawing and Sketching

Back

Semester 1

Semester 1 Subjects:

In the first semester, you will be introduced to the basics of drawing, focusing on fundamental techniques and observational skills.

    Introduction to Drawing: Fundamentals of drawing, materials, and techniques for beginners.

    Basic Shapes and Forms: Drawing geometric shapes and understanding their proportions and relationships.

    Sketching Techniques: Various sketching methods, including contour, gesture, and shading techniques.

    Observation and Composition: Learning to observe and compose scenes effectively.

    Introduction to Color: Basic color theory and applying color to drawings.

Recommended Reference Books:

    The Natural Way to Draw by Kimon Nicolaides

    Drawing on the Right Side of the Brain by Betty Edwards

    Keys to Drawing by Bert Dodson

YouTube Channels for Semester 1 Subjects:

    English: Drawabox

    Hindi: Art Kraft

Semester 2

Semester 2 Subjects:

In the second semester, you will deepen your drawing skills and explore different styles and techniques.

    Figure Drawing: Introduction to drawing the human figure, anatomy, and proportions.

    Perspective Drawing: Understanding one-point and two-point perspective techniques.

    Still Life Drawing: Techniques for drawing still life compositions using various materials.

    Character Design: Basics of character design and expression through drawing.

    Advanced Shading Techniques: Mastering shading techniques for depth and realism.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Figure Drawing for All It's Worth by Andrew Loomis

    Perspective Made Easy by Ernest R. Norling

    The Complete Guide to Anatomy for Artists & Illustrators by Gottfried Bammes

YouTube Channels for Semester 2 Subjects:

    English: Proko

    Hindi: Chhota Chashma

Semester 3

Semester 3 Subjects:

In the third semester, you’ll explore more complex subjects in drawing and develop your unique style.

    Portrait Drawing: Techniques for drawing realistic portraits, including features and expressions.

    Landscape Drawing: Approaches to drawing landscapes, including composition and natural elements.

    Gesture Drawing: Capturing movement and emotion through quick sketches of figures.

    Mixed Media Techniques: Exploring different drawing mediums, such as charcoal, ink, and pastels.

    Experimental Drawing: Encouraging creativity through unconventional drawing methods.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Drawing Portraits for the Absolute Beginner by Carolyn Scrace

    Drawing Landscapes in Pencil by D. J. Phillips

    Drawing with Pen and Ink by John M. Hulme

YouTube Channels for Semester 3 Subjects:

    English: Draw More

    Hindi: Drawing Pencil

Semester 4

Semester 4 Subjects:

In the fourth semester, you will focus on integrating your drawing skills with other disciplines.

    Illustration Techniques: Basics of illustration, including narrative and thematic drawing.

    Concept Art: Introduction to concept art for games and animation.

    Architectural Drawing: Techniques for drawing buildings and structures.

    Digital Drawing: Exploring digital drawing tools and techniques using software like Procreate or Adobe Fresco.

    Art Critique and Feedback: Understanding how to give and receive constructive criticism on drawings.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Creating Characters with Personality by Tom Bancroft

    The Art of Animal Drawing by Ken Hultgren

    Digital Painting Techniques by 3DTotal Publishing

YouTube Channels for Semester 4 Subjects:

    English: Sycra

    Hindi: Draw Anything

Semester 5

Semester 5 Subjects:

In the fifth semester, you will focus on refining your drawing techniques and building a professional portfolio.

    Advanced Illustration: Techniques for creating polished illustrations for books and media.

    Editorial and Advertising Illustration: Drawing for editorial content and advertising campaigns.

    Art Direction: Exploring the role of an art director in visual communication.

    Building a Professional Portfolio: Strategies for compiling a strong portfolio for job applications.

    Client Management: Basics of working with clients and understanding project requirements.

Recommended Reference Books:

    The Art of Comic Book Inking by Gary Martin

    The Complete Guide to Professional Portfolio Development by Michael J. Egan

    Illustration School: Let's Draw Cute Animals by Suzannne Roth

YouTube Channels for Semester 5 Subjects:

    English: Draw It Too

    Hindi: Art On The Go

Semester 6

Semester 6 Subjects:

In the sixth semester, you will work on professional projects and internships to gain real-world experience.

    Capstone Project I: Start a major drawing project that showcases your skills and creativity.

    Design Internship: Participate in an internship to apply your drawing skills in a professional setting.

    Art and Society: Explore the role of art and drawing in cultural and social contexts.

    Advanced Digital Techniques: Further develop your digital drawing skills, focusing on advanced tools and methods.

    Exhibition Preparation: Preparing artworks for exhibitions and public display.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Drawing the Head and Hands by Andrew Loomis

    Art That Sells: How to Make a Living as a Commercial Artist by Lilla Rogers

    The Creative's Guide to Starting a Business by Harriet Kelsall

YouTube Channels for Semester 6 Subjects:

    English: ArtRage

    Hindi: Art N Design

Semester 7

Semester 7 Subjects:

In the seventh semester, you will finalize your capstone project and prepare for a career in drawing and illustration.

    Capstone Project II: Complete your major drawing project and present it to faculty and industry experts.

    Entrepreneurship in Art: Learn the business aspects of being a professional artist.

    Advanced Illustration Techniques: Explore specialized illustration techniques for various media.

    Portfolio Development: Finalize and refine your portfolio for job applications and exhibitions.

    Networking in the Art World: Strategies for building connections within the creative industry.

Recommended Reference Books:

    How to Be a Graphic Designer Without Losing Your Soul by Adrian Shaughnessy

    Making Comics by Scott McCloud

    Drawing on the Right Side of the Brain Workbook by Betty Edwards

YouTube Channels for Semester 7 Subjects:

    English: Illustration for Kids

    Hindi: The Art Channel

Semester 8

Semester 8 Subjects:

The eighth semester is dedicated to finalizing your capstone project, showcasing your work, and preparing for graduation.

    Final Capstone Presentation: Present your completed capstone project to faculty and industry professionals.

    Advanced Portfolio Review: Get feedback on your portfolio from industry experts.

    Independent Project: Undertake a personal drawing project that showcases your style and vision.

    Art Exhibition Participation: Participate in a final exhibition showcasing your work to the public.

    Career Preparation: Preparing for job interviews, freelancing, or further education.

Recommended Reference Books:

    The Artist's Way by Julia Cameron

    Drawing and Painting Animals by James Gurney

    Sketching from the Imagination by 3DTotal Publishing

YouTube Channels for Semester 8 Subjects:

    English: Art Academy

    Hindi: Creative Vibes

Future Paths

    Illustrator: Create illustrations for books, magazines, and advertising.

    Storyboard Artist: Develop storyboards for films, animation, and video games.

    Concept Artist: Design visual concepts for characters, environments, and scenes.

    Fine Artist: Create original artwork for galleries and exhibitions.

    Art Instructor: Teach drawing and illustration skills to students of various ages.

Preparation Tips

    Practice Regularly: Consistent practice is key to improving your drawing skills.

    Study Art Fundamentals: Master the basics of anatomy, perspective, and composition.

    Experiment with Styles: Explore various drawing styles to find your unique voice.

    Seek Feedback: Get critiques from peers and mentors to improve your work.

    Participate in Workshops: Attend drawing workshops and classes to expand your skills.

    Back

3D Design

Back

Semester 1

Semester 1 Subjects:

In the first semester, you will be introduced to the fundamentals of 3D design and modeling techniques.

    Introduction to 3D Design: Overview of 3D design concepts, tools, and applications.

    Basic Modeling Techniques: Introduction to basic 3D modeling techniques using software like Blender or Autodesk Maya.

    Materials and Textures: Understanding materials, textures, and their applications in 3D design.

    Lighting Techniques: Basics of lighting in 3D environments to create mood and realism.

    Rendering Basics: Introduction to rendering techniques and settings for 3D models.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Blender For Dummies by Jason van Gumster

    The Complete Guide to 3D Game Design by David N. Hurst

    Digital Modeling by William Vaughan

YouTube Channels for Semester 1 Subjects:

    English: Blender Foundation

    Hindi: 3D Animation Hindi

Semester 2

Semester 2 Subjects:

In the second semester, you will build on the foundational skills learned in the first semester.

    Advanced Modeling Techniques: Exploring advanced techniques in 3D modeling and design.

    Sculpting in 3D: Introduction to digital sculpting techniques for character and object creation.

    Animation Basics: Fundamentals of 3D animation and motion principles.

    Character Design: Techniques for designing and modeling 3D characters.

    Basic Rigging: Introduction to character rigging and setting up models for animation.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Digital Sculpting in 3D by 3DTotal Publishing

    The Animator's Survival Kit by Richard Williams

    Creating Characters in Blender by John M. Blaskowski

YouTube Channels for Semester 2 Subjects:

    English: Blender Guru

    Hindi: Hindi Search

Semester 3

Semester 3 Subjects:

In the third semester, you will explore more complex 3D design and animation techniques.

    Environmental Design: Creating 3D environments, landscapes, and architectural models.

    Texturing and Shading: Advanced techniques for creating realistic textures and shaders.

    Lighting Techniques II: Advanced lighting techniques for creating mood and depth.

    Character Animation: In-depth study of character animation principles and practices.

    Camera Techniques: Understanding camera movement and angles in 3D animation.

Recommended Reference Books:

    3D Game Programming All in One by Christopher Carbone

    3D Animation Essentials by Andy Beane

    The Art of 3D Computer Animation and Effects by Isaac V. Kerlow

YouTube Channels for Semester 3 Subjects:

    English: ECApprentice

    Hindi: 3D Animation Tutorials

Semester 4

Semester 4 Subjects:

In the fourth semester, you will integrate your skills and explore the use of 3D design in various industries.

    Product Design: Basics of designing 3D products for various industries.

    3D Printing: Understanding 3D printing processes and preparing models for printing.

    Game Design Basics: Introduction to game design concepts and applying 3D skills in game development.

    Visual Effects (VFX): Basics of integrating 3D design with video and animation for visual effects.

    Design Portfolio Development: Compiling a portfolio showcasing your 3D design work.

Recommended Reference Books:

    3D Printing for Dummies by Rahman Jamal

    Game Development Essentials: An Introduction by Jeannie Novak

    Creating 3D Game Art for the iPhone with Unity by John R. M. R. Bracken

YouTube Channels for Semester 4 Subjects:

    English: 3D Printing Prof

    Hindi: 3D Tech

Semester 5

Semester 5 Subjects:

In the fifth semester, you will refine your skills and work on advanced projects.

    Advanced Character Rigging: Techniques for complex character rigging and animation.

    Lighting and Rendering II: Advanced lighting and rendering techniques for professional results.

    Motion Graphics: Introduction to creating motion graphics using 3D design.

    Visual Storytelling: Understanding how to tell stories through 3D design and animation.

    Freelancing in 3D Design: Strategies for finding freelance work and managing projects.

Recommended Reference Books:

    3D Animation Fundamentals by David O'Reilly

    Lighting for Animation: How to Use Light, Color, and Camera to Create Emotion in 3D Animation by Andrew Klein

    Creating Motion Graphics with After Effects by Chris and Trish Meyer

YouTube Channels for Semester 5 Subjects:

    English: Video Copilot

    Hindi: Hindi VFX

Semester 6

Semester 6 Subjects:

In the sixth semester, you will engage in practical projects and collaborative work.

    Capstone Project I: Begin your major project that showcases your 3D design skills.

    Collaborative Design Projects: Work in teams to create 3D projects for real clients.

    3D Animation for Games: Focus on creating 3D animations specifically for games.

    Product Visualization: Techniques for creating realistic product visualizations for marketing.

    Professional Development: Skills and strategies for building a career in 3D design.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Blender 3D: Noob to Pro by Wikibooks

    3D Modeling for Beginners by Mike F. Smith

    Game Development Essentials: An Introduction by Jeannie Novak

YouTube Channels for Semester 6 Subjects:

    English: CG Boost

    Hindi: Learn 3D Hindi

Semester 7

Semester 7 Subjects:

In the seventh semester, you will finalize your capstone project and prepare for industry entry.

    Capstone Project II: Complete your major project and present it to faculty and industry experts.

    Advanced Game Design: Explore advanced concepts in game design using 3D assets.

    Visual Effects in Film: Understanding the integration of 3D design in film production.

    Networking and Marketing: Learn strategies for marketing yourself as a 3D designer.

    Industry Trends and Innovations: Stay updated on the latest trends in 3D design and technology.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Game Engine Architecture by Jason Gregory

    The Visual Effects Producer: A Handbook for Film and Television by Charles Knode

    Digital Art for Beginners by Scott Wong

YouTube Channels for Semester 7 Subjects:

    English: The Third Floor

    Hindi: Hindi Designs

Semester 8

Semester 8 Subjects:

The eighth semester is dedicated to finalizing your capstone project, showcasing your work, and preparing for graduation.

    Final Capstone Presentation: Present your completed capstone project to faculty and industry professionals.

    Advanced Portfolio Review: Get feedback on your portfolio from industry experts.

    Independent Project: Undertake a personal 3D design project that showcases your style and vision.

    Art Exhibition Participation: Participate in a final exhibition showcasing your work to the public.

    Career Preparation: Preparing for job interviews, freelancing, or further education.

Recommended Reference Books:

    The Artist's Way by Julia Cameron

    3D Modeling and Animation: A Practical Guide by William J. Decker

    Digital Art Techniques by Andrew K. Smith

YouTube Channels for Semester 8 Subjects:

    English: 3D Buzz

    Hindi: Design 3D

Future Paths

    3D Modeler: Create 3D models for various industries including games and film.

    3D Animator: Work on character and object animations for media.

    Game Designer: Design and develop engaging game experiences.

    Visual Effects Artist: Create visual effects for film and television.

    Product Designer: Design products for commercial use using 3D modeling techniques.

Preparation Tips

    Practice Regularly: Consistent practice is key to mastering 3D design software.

    Study Design Principles: Master the basics of design principles for 3D applications.

    Experiment with Projects: Work on various projects to diversify your skills and portfolio.

    Seek Feedback: Get critiques from peers and mentors to improve your work.

    Participate in Online Communities: Join forums and groups focused on 3D design to learn and share knowledge.

    Back

Interaction Design

Back

Semester 1

Semester 1 Subjects:

The first semester introduces you to the foundational principles of interaction design and user experience.

    Introduction to Interaction Design: Overview of interaction design and its importance in user experience.

    User-Centered Design Principles: Fundamental principles focusing on user needs and behaviors.

    Design Thinking: Understanding the design thinking process and methodologies.

    Visual Design Basics: Introduction to visual design principles and elements.

    Usability Testing Fundamentals: Basics of conducting usability tests to evaluate designs.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Don't Make Me Think by Steve Krug

    The Design of Everyday Things by Don Norman

    About Face: The Essentials of Interaction Design by Alan Cooper

YouTube Channels for Semester 1 Subjects:

    English: UXPin

    Hindi: UX Hindi

Semester 2

Semester 2 Subjects:

The second semester builds on foundational skills and explores user research methodologies.

    User Research Methods: Techniques for gathering user feedback and insights.

    Wireframing and Prototyping: Introduction to creating wireframes and prototypes for interaction design.

    Information Architecture: Understanding how to structure information for user-friendly navigation.

    Interaction Design Patterns: Exploring common design patterns used in interaction design.

    Accessibility in Design: Principles of designing for diverse user needs.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Designing with the Mind in Mind by Jeff Johnson

    Lean UX: Designing Great Products with Agile Teams by Jeff Gothelf

    Rocket Surgery Made Easy by Steve Krug

YouTube Channels for Semester 2 Subjects:

    English: The Futur

    Hindi: Design Tribe India

Semester 3

Semester 3 Subjects:

The third semester focuses on advanced interaction design techniques and methodologies.

    Advanced Prototyping Techniques: Techniques for creating high-fidelity prototypes.

    Interaction Animation: Understanding the role of animations in enhancing user experience.

    Mobile Interaction Design: Principles of designing for mobile platforms.

    Web Interaction Design: Best practices for designing web interactions.

    User Feedback Analysis: Methods for analyzing and interpreting user feedback.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Designing Interfaces by Jenifer Tidwell

    Designing for Interaction by Dan Saffer

    Interaction Design: Beyond Human-Computer Interaction by Jenny Preece

YouTube Channels for Semester 3 Subjects:

    English: Adobe Creative Cloud

    Hindi: Hindi Design Tutorials

Semester 4

Semester 4 Subjects:

The fourth semester emphasizes design implementation and evaluating design effectiveness.

    Usability Testing Advanced: Advanced techniques for conducting usability tests.

    Design Implementation: Strategies for implementing design solutions.

    Collaborative Design Techniques: Working in teams to design and evaluate interactions.

    Content Strategy: Understanding the importance of content in interaction design.

    Design Ethics: Exploring ethical considerations in design practices.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Content Strategy for the Web by Kristina Halvorson

    Interaction Design: Beyond Human-Computer Interaction by Jenny Preece

    Designing Web Usability by Jakob Nielsen

YouTube Channels for Semester 4 Subjects:

    English: UX Mastery

    Hindi: Design Studio Hindi

Semester 5

Semester 5 Subjects:

The fifth semester focuses on portfolio development and preparing for the industry.

    Portfolio Development: Compiling a professional portfolio showcasing your work.

    Industry Trends: Staying updated on the latest trends in interaction design.

    Design for Emerging Technologies: Exploring interaction design for AI, VR, and AR.

    Networking Strategies: Techniques for building a professional network in the industry.

    Career Preparation: Preparing for job interviews and creating a personal brand.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Designing for the Digital Age by Kim Goodwin

    Hooked: How to Build Habit-Forming Products by Nir Eyal

    The Lean Startup by Eric Ries

YouTube Channels for Semester 5 Subjects:

    English: Mobile UX

    Hindi: Tech Hindi

Semester 6

Semester 6 Subjects:

The sixth semester allows you to apply your skills in practical projects and collaborative work.

    Capstone Project I: Begin your major project that showcases your interaction design skills.

    Collaborative Design Projects: Work in teams to create interactive design solutions.

    Advanced User Testing: Conduct extensive user testing to refine your designs.

    Interaction Design for Mobile Applications: Focus on designing for mobile platforms.

    Professional Development: Strategies for navigating the design industry.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Designing Mobile Interfaces by Steven Hoober

    Understanding Your Users by Kathy Baxter

    Mobile First by Luke Wroblewski

YouTube Channels for Semester 6 Subjects:

    English: Mobile UX

    Hindi: UX Hindi

Semester 7

Semester 7 Subjects:

The seventh semester emphasizes the completion of your capstone project and preparation for industry entry.

    Capstone Project II: Complete your major project and present it to faculty and industry experts.

    Advanced Interaction Design: Exploring cutting-edge interaction design techniques.

    Design for Social Impact: Understanding the role of design in addressing social issues.

    Networking and Personal Branding: Learn how to effectively promote your design skills.

    Current Trends in Interaction Design: Stay updated on the latest innovations in the field.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Designing for Interaction by Dan Saffer

    Designing Interfaces by Jenifer Tidwell

    Microinteractions by Dan Saffer

YouTube Channels for Semester 7 Subjects:

    English: UX Mastery

    Hindi: Design Tribe India

Semester 8

Semester 8 Subjects:

The eighth semester is dedicated to finalizing your capstone project, showcasing your work, and preparing for graduation.

    Final Capstone Presentation: Present your completed capstone project to faculty and industry professionals.

    Advanced Portfolio Review: Get feedback on your portfolio from industry experts.

    Independent Project: Undertake a personal interaction design project that showcases your style and vision.

    Design Exhibition Participation: Participate in a final exhibition showcasing your work to the public.

    Career Preparation: Preparing for job interviews, freelancing, or further education.

Recommended Reference Books:

    The Elements of User Experience by Jesse James Garrett

    Designing for Interaction by Dan Saffer

    The User Experience Team of One by Leah Buley

YouTube Channels for Semester 8 Subjects:

    English: UXPin

    Hindi: Design 3D

Future Paths

    Interaction Designer: Design interactive systems and experiences.

    User Experience (UX) Researcher: Conduct research to improve user experience.

    User Interface (UI) Designer: Design user interfaces for websites and applications.

    Usability Analyst: Evaluate and improve product usability.

    Product Designer: Work on the design of digital products focusing on user needs.

Preparation Tips

    Practice Regularly: Consistent practice is key to mastering design tools and techniques.

    Study Design Principles: Master the basics of design principles for interaction applications.

    Experiment with Projects: Work on various projects to diversify your skills and portfolio.

    Seek Feedback: Get critiques from peers and mentors to improve your work.

    Participate in Online Communities: Join forums and groups focused on interaction design to learn and share knowledge.

Digital Design

Back

Semester 1

Semester 1 Subjects:

The first semester introduces foundational concepts in digital design and graphic communication.

    Introduction to Digital Design: Overview of digital design principles and practices.

    Graphic Design Fundamentals: Basics of graphic design, including typography, color theory, and layout.

    Adobe Photoshop Basics: Introduction to Photoshop for digital image editing and manipulation.

    Visual Communication: Understanding how to communicate ideas visually through design.

    Design Software Skills: Learning the basics of various design software.

Recommended Reference Books:

    The Non-Designer's Design Book by Robin Williams

    Digital Design Basics by Steven Heller

    Graphic Design: The New Basics by Ellen Lupton

YouTube Channels for Semester 1 Subjects:

    English: Adobe Creative Cloud

    Hindi: Digital Design Hindi

Semester 2

Semester 2 Subjects:

The second semester expands on graphic design skills and introduces digital illustration.

    Digital Illustration Techniques: Introduction to creating digital illustrations using software.

    Adobe Illustrator Basics: Learning the basics of vector graphic design with Illustrator.

    Color Theory and Application: Understanding the psychological effects of color in design.

    Layout Design: Principles of effective layout design for digital media.

    Brand Identity Design: Basics of creating logos and brand visuals.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Adobe Illustrator Classroom in a Book by Brian Wood

    The Color Scheme Bible by Anna Starmer

    Logo Design Love by David Airey

    English: The Futur

    Hindi: Hindi Graphic Tutorials

Semester 3

Semester 3 Subjects:

The third semester focuses on digital media and interactive design principles.

    Interactive Design Principles: Understanding the basics of designing interactive digital experiences.

    Motion Graphics: Introduction to creating motion graphics for digital media.

    User Interface (UI) Design: Basics of designing user interfaces for digital products.

    Digital Photography Basics: Learning photography techniques for digital design.

    Web Design Fundamentals: Principles of designing effective and engaging web layouts.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Don't Make Me Think by Steve Krug

    Motion Graphics: Principles and Practice from the Ground Up by Ian Crook

    Web Design with HTML, CSS, JavaScript and jQuery Set by Jon Duckett

    English: UXPin

    Hindi: Design Hindi

Semester 4 Subjects:

The fourth semester emphasizes branding, marketing, and project management.

    Brand Strategy: Understanding the elements of a successful brand strategy.

    Digital Marketing Basics: Introduction to marketing principles in the digital landscape.

    Project Management for Designers: Basics of managing design projects effectively.

    Portfolio Development: Techniques for creating an impressive design portfolio.

    Design Ethics and Sustainability: Exploring ethical considerations in digital design.

    Building a StoryBrand by Donald Miller

    Made to Stick by Chip Heath

    Creative Confidence by Tom Kelley

    Hindi: Digital Marketing Hindi

    Digital Animation Basics: Introduction to animation techniques for digital media.

    Design for Emerging Technologies: Exploring design implications for AI and VR.

    Web Development Basics: Introduction to HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

    The Elements of User Experience by Jesse James Garrett

    The UX Book by Rex Hartson

    Hindi: Tech Hindi

Semester 6 Subjects:

The sixth semester allows you to work on real-world projects and apply your skills.

    Capstone Project I: Begin your major project that showcases your digital design skills.

    Collaborative Design Projects: Work in teams to create digital design solutions.

    Advanced User Testing: Conduct extensive user testing to refine your designs.

    Responsive Design: Learn how to design for various screen sizes and devices.

    Professional Development: Strategies for navigating the design industry.

Product Design

Back

Semester 1

Semester 1 Subjects:

The first semester introduces foundational concepts in product design and design thinking.

    Introduction to Product Design: Overview of the product design process and its significance.

    Design Fundamentals: Basics of design principles including form, function, and aesthetics.

    Materials and Manufacturing: Introduction to various materials and their manufacturing processes.

    Sketching and Visualization: Techniques for effective product sketching and visualization.

    Computer-Aided Design (CAD): Introduction to CAD software for creating design drawings.

Recommended Reference Books:

    The Design of Everyday Things by Don Norman

    Product Design: A Practical Guide to the New Product Development by Peter G. Rowe

    Sketching: Drawing Techniques for Product Designers by Koos Eissen

YouTube Channels for Semester 1 Subjects:

    English: New York City Design School

    Hindi: Design Lab Hindi

Semester 2

Semester 2 Subjects:

The second semester focuses on user-centered design and ergonomic considerations.

    User-Centered Design: Principles of designing products based on user needs and behaviors.

    Ergonomics in Product Design: Understanding human factors and ergonomics in design.

    Prototyping Techniques: Methods for creating product prototypes for testing and evaluation.

    Visual Communication: Techniques for effectively communicating design ideas.

    Basic Physics for Design: Introduction to physical principles that impact product design.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Designing for People by John C. McLoughlin

    Ergonomics: How to Design for Ease and Efficiency by A. Pheasant

    The Prototyping Playbook by Dr. Scott Sullivan

YouTube Channels for Semester 2 Subjects:

    English: Product Design Online

    Hindi: Hindi Product Design

Semester 3

Semester 3 Subjects:

The third semester focuses on advanced design processes and sustainability in design.

    Advanced Product Design: Techniques for creating innovative and market-ready products.

    Sustainable Design Practices: Exploring eco-friendly materials and sustainable design strategies.

    Market Research for Product Design: Conducting market research to inform design decisions.

    Design Ethics: Understanding ethical considerations in product design.

    Branding and Product Strategy: Basics of branding and product positioning.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Sustainable Product Design by G. B. De Damborenea

    Product Design and Development by Karl T. Ulrich

    The Art of Product Design by Hardi Meybaum

YouTube Channels for Semester 3 Subjects:

    English: The Design Course

    Hindi: Design Hindi

Semester 4

Semester 4 Subjects:

The fourth semester emphasizes design prototyping and testing.

    Rapid Prototyping Techniques: Exploring advanced prototyping methods for product testing.

    User Testing and Feedback: Techniques for gathering user feedback on product prototypes.

    Design for Manufacturing: Understanding the manufacturing process and its implications for design.

    Product Lifecycle Management: Overview of managing a product from conception to retirement.

    Computer-Aided Manufacturing (CAM): Introduction to CAM processes in product design.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Product Design and Development by Karl T. Ulrich

    The Design of Everyday Things by Don Norman

    Prototyping for Designers by Kevin J. McCullough

YouTube Channels for Semester 4 Subjects:

    English: UX Design Community

    Hindi: Design Tadka

Semester 5

Semester 5 Subjects:

The fifth semester focuses on specialization and innovation in product design.

    Special Topics in Product Design: Exploring niche areas in product design such as medical devices or consumer electronics.

    Design Innovation: Techniques for fostering creativity and innovation in design.

    Product Design Portfolio Development: Building a professional portfolio showcasing your best work.

    Design Presentation Skills: Techniques for effectively presenting design ideas.

    Entrepreneurship in Design: Basics of starting a design business or product line.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Creative Confidence by Tom Kelley

    The Innovator's Dilemma by Clayton Christensen

    Made to Stick by Chip Heath

    English: Art Center College of Design

    Hindi: Indo Hindi Tutorial

Semester 6 Subjects:

The sixth semester emphasizes the culmination of design projects and preparation for the industry.

    Capstone Project I: Begin your major project that showcases your product design skills.

    Collaborative Design Projects: Work in teams to create innovative product designs.

    Advanced User Testing: Conduct extensive user testing to refine your product designs.

    Product Marketing Strategies: Learn how to market and promote your product designs.

    Professional Development: Strategies for building a career in product design.

    Designing for Interaction by Dan Saffer

    How to Create Products That Sell by Michael R. Miller

    Product Design: A Practical Guide to the New Product Development by Peter G. Rowe

    Capstone Project II: Complete your major project and present it to faculty and industry experts.

    Design for Manufacturing and Assembly: Strategies for optimizing designs for production.

    Current Trends in Product Design: Stay updated on the latest innovations and trends in the field.

    Networking and Personal Branding: Learn how to effectively promote your design skills.

    Branding by Design by Christopher S. V. Shultz

    Hindi: Indo Products Design

The eighth semester is dedicated to finalizing your capstone project, showcasing your work, and preparing for graduation.

    Advanced Portfolio Review: Get feedback on your portfolio from industry experts.

    Independent Project: Undertake a personal product design project that showcases your style and vision.

    Design Exhibition Participation: Participate in a final exhibition showcasing your work to the public.

    Career Preparation: Preparing for job interviews, freelancing, or further education.

Future Paths

    Product Designer: Create innovative and functional products for various industries.

    Industrial Designer: Focus on the design of mass-produced products and consumer goods.

    User Experience (UX) Designer: Enhance user interaction with physical products.

    Design Consultant: Provide expertise in product design to businesses and organizations.

    Entrepreneur: Start your own product line or design firm.

Preparation Tips

    Practice Regularly: Consistent practice is key to mastering design tools and techniques.

    Study Design Principles: Master the basics of design principles for products.

    Experiment with Projects: Work on various projects to diversify your skills and portfolio.

    Seek Feedback: Get critiques from peers and mentors to improve your work.

    Participate in Online Communities: Join forums and groups focused on product design to learn and share knowledge.

Graphic Design

Back

Semester 1

Semester 1 Subjects:

The first semester introduces the basics of graphic design, including color theory and typography.

    Introduction to Graphic Design: Overview of graphic design principles and history.

    Color Theory: Understanding color combinations, palettes, and their psychological impact.

    Typography: Fundamentals of typeface selection, arrangement, and readability.

    Drawing Fundamentals: Basic drawing skills essential for visual communication.

    Software Proficiency: Introduction to graphic design software (Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator).

Recommended Reference Books:

    The Elements of Graphic Design by Alex W. White

    Graphic Design School by David Dabner

    Thinking with Type by Ellen Lupton

YouTube Channels for Semester 1 Subjects:

    English: Adobe Creative Cloud

    Hindi: The Design Gist

Semester 2

Semester 2 Subjects:

The second semester focuses on design principles and composition.

    Design Principles: Exploration of balance, contrast, alignment, and repetition.

    Composition Techniques: Understanding layout and composition in graphic design.

    Digital Illustration: Techniques for creating digital illustrations using graphic software.

    Branding Basics: Introduction to brand identity and logo design.

    Print Design: Understanding design for print media, including brochures and posters.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Graphic Design: A New History by Stephen J. Eskilson

    Logo Design Love by David Airey

    Making and Breaking the Grid by Timothy Samara

YouTube Channels for Semester 2 Subjects:

    English: Yes I'm Creative

    Hindi: Hindi Graphic Design

Semester 3

Semester 3 Subjects:

The third semester emphasizes advanced graphic design techniques and project work.

    Advanced Typography: Exploring typographic hierarchy and experimental typography.

    Web Design Basics: Introduction to web design principles and responsive design.

    Motion Graphics: Basics of animation and motion graphics in design.

    UI/UX Design Principles: Understanding user interface and user experience design.

    Portfolio Development: Creating a professional portfolio showcasing your work.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Don't Make Me Think by Steve Krug

    The Graphic Designer's Guide to Pricing, Estimating, and Budgeting by Theo Stephan

    The UX Book by Rex Hartson

YouTube Channels for Semester 3 Subjects:

    English: Jesse Showalter

    Hindi: Design With Me

Semester 4

Semester 4 Subjects:

The fourth semester focuses on branding, marketing, and strategic design.

    Brand Development: Creating a brand strategy and visual identity.

    Marketing Fundamentals: Basics of marketing principles in graphic design.

    Environmental Graphics: Designing for spatial environments and signage.

    Advanced Illustration Techniques: Exploring various styles and techniques in illustration.

    Freelancing and Business Skills: Essentials of running a freelance design business.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Building a StoryBrand by Donald Miller

    The Business of Design by Keith Granet

    Designing Brand Identity by Alina Wheeler

YouTube Channels for Semester 4 Subjects:

    English: The Futur

    Hindi: Creative Hindi

Semester 5

Semester 5 Subjects:

The fifth semester emphasizes the development of advanced projects and skills.

    Advanced Graphic Design Techniques: Techniques for creating compelling and innovative designs.

    Print Production Techniques: Understanding the print production process and preparing files.

    Digital Publishing: Basics of e-books, magazines, and online publications.

    Design for Advertising: Principles of creating effective advertising graphics.

    Client Relations: Best practices for working with clients and managing projects.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Designing for the Digital Age by Kim Jack and Ellen Lupton

    Graphic Design: The New Basics by Ellen Lupton

    The Art of Graphic Design by Paul Rand

    English: Yes I’m Creative

    Hindi: Learn Graphic Design Hindi

The sixth semester focuses on portfolio development and industry preparation.

    Portfolio Refinement: Finalizing and enhancing your graphic design portfolio.

    Creative Process Exploration: Understanding and developing your creative process.

    Industry Trends and Insights: Keeping up with current trends in graphic design.

    Presentation Skills: How to present and defend your design work effectively.

    Graphic Design in Social Media: Designing for various social media platforms.

Recommended Reference Books:

    The Graphic Designer's Guide to Portfolio Design by T. A. Watson

    Creative Workshop: 80 Challenges to Sharpen Your Design Skills by David Sherwin

    Graphic Design: A New History by Stephen J. Eskilson

    Hindi: Hindi Graphic Design

    Web and Mobile Design: Best practices for designing for web and mobile platforms.

    Packaging Design: Principles of creating effective and attractive packaging.

    Client Presentation: Presenting design concepts and receiving feedback.

Semester 8 Subjects:

The eighth semester culminates in the completion and presentation of the capstone project.

    Final Capstone Presentation: Present your completed capstone project to faculty and industry professionals.

    Advanced Portfolio Development: Finalizing your portfolio for job applications.

    Job Search Strategies: Techniques for finding and applying for design jobs.

    Networking Skills: Building connections within the graphic design industry.

    Career Preparation: Preparing for interviews and freelance opportunities.

    The Graphic Artist and Designer's Market by Mary Cox

    Brand Designer: Focus on developing brand identities and strategies.

    Web Designer: Specialize in designing user-friendly websites.

    UI/UX Designer: Enhance user experience for digital products.

    Illustrator: Create original illustrations for various media.

Preparation Tips

    Practice Regularly: Keep experimenting with design tools and techniques.

    Build a Strong Portfolio: Showcase a variety of projects that reflect your skills.

    Seek Feedback: Get critiques from peers and mentors to improve your work.

    Stay Updated: Follow design trends and industry news to stay relevant.

    Network with Professionals: Join design communities and attend events to connect with others.

Motion Graphics

Back

Semester 1

Semester 1 Subjects:

The first semester introduces the foundational concepts of motion graphics.

    Introduction to Motion Graphics: Overview of motion graphics and its applications.

    Basic Animation Principles: Understanding keyframes, timing, and easing.

    Color Theory: Basics of color theory in animation and design.

    Typography in Motion: How to animate text effectively.

    Software Proficiency: Introduction to motion graphics software (Adobe After Effects).

Recommended Reference Books:

    The Animator's Survival Kit by Richard Williams

    Motion Design 101 by Chris Jackson

    Creating Motion Graphics with After Effects by Chris and Trish Meyer

YouTube Channels for Semester 1 Subjects:

    English: School of Motion

    Hindi: Creative Hindi

Semester 2

Semester 2 Subjects:

The second semester focuses on advanced animation techniques and storytelling.

    Animation Techniques: Exploring 2D and 3D animation techniques.

    Storyboarding: Creating storyboards for motion graphics projects.

    Visual Effects Basics: Introduction to visual effects in motion graphics.

    Sound Design: Basics of sound design and audio integration in motion graphics.

    Project Management: Best practices for managing motion graphics projects.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Motion Graphics in 30 Seconds by Richard Williams

    The Complete Guide to After Effects by Andrew Kramer

    Design for Motion: Fundamentals and Techniques by Ben W. McMillan

YouTube Channels for Semester 2 Subjects:

    English: Motion Design School

    Hindi: Hindi Motion Graphics

Semester 3

Semester 3 Subjects:

The third semester emphasizes the integration of design principles in motion graphics.

    Design Principles: Understanding design principles in animation.

    Character Animation: Techniques for creating animated characters.

    Advanced After Effects Techniques: Exploring advanced features of After Effects.

    Motion Graphics for Branding: Designing animations for brand identities.

    Client Interaction: Best practices for collaborating with clients.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Animation from Pencils to Pixels by Tony White

    Motion Graphics for Designers by Ian L. Smith

    After Effects Apprentice by Trish and Chris Meyer

    English: Motion Graphics TV

    Hindi: Animation and Motion Graphics Hindi

Semester 4

Semester 4 Subjects:

The fourth semester focuses on advanced project work and collaboration.

    Collaborative Projects: Working in teams to create motion graphics projects.

    Advanced Visual Effects: Techniques for creating advanced visual effects.

    Motion Graphics for Advertising: Designing animations for promotional content.

    Case Studies: Analyzing successful motion graphics campaigns.

    Creative Problem Solving: Developing solutions for design challenges.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Creative Motion Graphics: Techniques for Success by Robert P. Zappia

    Motion Design: A Practical Guide to Creating Motion Graphics by David G. McCoy

    The Art of Motion Graphics by David Flaherty

    English: Greyscale Gorilla

    Hindi: Hindi Graphic Motion

Semester 5 Subjects:

The fifth semester emphasizes advanced techniques and self-directed projects.

    Capstone Project I: Begin a major motion graphics project showcasing your skills.

    Advanced Character Animation: In-depth techniques for character animation.

    Interactive Motion Graphics: Creating motion graphics for interactive media.

    Designing for Virtual Reality: Introduction to motion graphics in VR environments.

    Client Briefs: Working on real-world client briefs and projects.

    Designing for Motion: A Guide to Interactive Media by Andy R. Davis

    Motion Graphics in Practice by Steven J. Anderson

    English: The Motion Design Society

    Hindi: Hindi Motion Animation

The sixth semester focuses on portfolio development and industry preparation.

    Creative Process Exploration: Understanding and developing your creative process.

    Industry Trends and Insights: Keeping up with current trends in motion graphics.

    Final Capstone Presentation: Present your completed capstone project to faculty and industry professionals.

    Advanced Portfolio Development: Finalizing your portfolio for job applications.

    Job Search Strategies: Techniques for finding and applying for motion graphics jobs.

    Networking Skills: Building connections within the motion graphics industry.

Future Paths

    Motion Graphic Designer: Create engaging visual content through animation.

    Visual Effects Artist: Work on film and television effects and animations.

    3D Animator: Specialize in creating 3D animations for various media.

    Multimedia Artist: Work across different platforms, including video games and online content.

    Creative Director: Oversee motion graphics projects from concept to completion.

    Practice Regularly: Keep experimenting with design tools and animation techniques.

    Build a Strong Portfolio: Showcase a variety of projects that reflect your skills.

    Seek Feedback: Get critiques from peers and mentors to improve your work.

    Stay Updated: Follow design trends and industry news to stay relevant.

    Network with Professionals: Join design communities and attend events to connect with others.

Environmental and Spatial Design

Back

Semester 1

Semester 1 Subjects:

The first semester introduces the basics of environmental design and spatial awareness.

    Introduction to Environmental Design: Overview of environmental design principles.

    Spatial Awareness: Understanding space and its impact on design.

    Design Fundamentals: Basics of design theory and principles.

    Drawing Techniques: Developing skills in drawing and sketching for design.

    Materials and Processes: Introduction to various materials used in design.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Environmental Design: An Introduction for Architects and Designers by David J. Brown

    Space Planning Basics by Mark Karlen

    Designing with Light: The Challenge of the Senses by David D. H. Smith

YouTube Channels for Semester 1 Subjects:

    English: Design with Me

    Hindi: Design Hindi Tutorials

Semester 2

Semester 2 Subjects:

The second semester focuses on the relationship between space and human behavior.

    Human Factors in Design: Exploring how people interact with spaces.

    Site Analysis: Techniques for analyzing and understanding site conditions.

    Design Communication: Methods of communicating design ideas effectively.

    3D Modeling: Introduction to 3D modeling techniques for spatial design.

    Environmental Sustainability: Principles of sustainable design practices.

Recommended Reference Books:

    People Places: Design Guidelines for Urban Open Space by Clare Cooper Marcus

    Architectural Graphics by Francis D.K. Ching

    Designing the Landscape: An Introduction to the Art of Landscape Design by David W. McCullough

YouTube Channels for Semester 2 Subjects:

    English: Architecture is Fun

    Hindi: Hindi Architecture Channel

Semester 3

Semester 3 Subjects:

The third semester delves into environmental design theories and applications.

    Environmental Design Theory: Exploring key theories in environmental design.

    Lighting Design: Principles and techniques for effective lighting in spaces.

    Color in Space: Understanding color theory in relation to spatial design.

    Furniture Design: Basics of designing furniture for various environments.

    Landscape Design: Principles of designing outdoor spaces.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Designing for People by Henry Dreyfuss

    Environmental Sustainability: A Property Developer's Perspective by David D. Barlow

    Light in the Landscape: Lighting Design and the Environment by Anthony McKee

YouTube Channels for Semester 3 Subjects:

    English: The Design School

    Hindi: Hindi Design Tutorials

Semester 4

Semester 4 Subjects:

The fourth semester focuses on design projects and the design process.

    Design Project I: Working on a practical design project.

    Urban Design Principles: Basics of urban design and planning.

    Materials in Design: In-depth study of materials used in environmental design.

    Building Systems: Understanding building systems and their impact on design.

    Presentation Techniques: Methods for presenting design projects effectively.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Site Planning and Design Handbook by Thomas Russ

    Architectural Drafting and Design by Alan Jefferis

    Design of Everyday Things by Don Norman

YouTube Channels for Semester 4 Subjects:

    English: Design Talks

    Hindi: Design Hindi

Semester 5

Semester 5 Subjects:

The fifth semester emphasizes advanced spatial design and project work.

    Design Project II: Further developing your design project with a focus on spatial design.

    Interior Design Principles: Basics of interior design and spatial arrangement.

    Behavioral Design: Exploring how design affects human behavior.

    Sustainable Practices: Implementing sustainable practices in design projects.

    Technical Drawing: Skills for producing technical drawings and plans.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Interior Design: A Practical Guide by John Pile

    Sustainable Architecture: Sustainable Design Strategies for Architects and Engineers by Thomas A. B. T. DeMarco

    Drawing for Design by Thomas McGowen

YouTube Channels for Semester 5 Subjects:

    English: The Architecture Academy

    Hindi: Hindi Design Academy

Semester 6

Semester 6 Subjects:

The sixth semester focuses on advanced projects and professional preparation.

    Capstone Project I: Initiating a comprehensive design project.

    Advanced Spatial Design: Exploring complex spatial design challenges.

    Design Theory Application: Applying design theories to practical projects.

    Client Relations: Understanding client needs and project management.

    Professional Practice: Preparing for a career in environmental design.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Architectural Design: A Practical Guide by David Chappell

    The Professional Practice of Architectural Working Drawings by Osamu A. Wakita

    Design: The Key Concepts by Michael Erlhoff

YouTube Channels for Semester 6 Subjects:

    English: Urban Design

    Hindi: Architecture & Design in Hindi

Semester 7

Semester 7 Subjects:

The seventh semester is dedicated to project implementation and advanced design concepts.

    Capstone Project II: Completing your major design project.

    Smart Design Technologies: Incorporating technology into design.

    Behavioral Analysis in Design: Understanding user behavior for effective design.

    Environmental Impact Assessment: Evaluating the impact of designs on the environment.

    Design Ethics: Exploring ethical considerations in design practice.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Design with Nature by Ian L. McHarg

    The Nature of Design: Ecology, Culture, and Human Intention by David W. Orr

    Designing for the Future: Sustainability and Innovation in the Built Environment by Robert T. F. Lee

YouTube Channels for Semester 7 Subjects:

    English: Architectural Digest

    Hindi: Architecture Hindi

Semester 8

Semester 8 Subjects:

The eighth semester culminates in the completion and presentation of the capstone project.

    Final Capstone Presentation: Present your completed capstone project to faculty and industry professionals.

    Portfolio Development: Finalizing your portfolio for job applications.

    Job Search Strategies: Techniques for finding and applying for environmental design jobs.

    Networking Skills: Building connections within the design industry.

    Career Preparation: Preparing for interviews and freelance opportunities.

Recommended Reference Books:

    The Architect's Handbook of Professional Practice by Joseph A. Demkin

    Creating a Portfolio: The Essential Guide to Portfolio Development by Andrea Marks

    Design Your Future: 150+ Ideas for Your Career in Design by Michael A. S. Henderson

YouTube Channels for Semester 8 Subjects:

    English: Adam Korr

    Hindi: Hindi Architecture Tutorials

Future Paths

    Environmental Designer: Design spaces that enhance human experience and environmental quality.

    Interior Designer: Create functional and aesthetically pleasing interior spaces.

    Urban Planner: Develop plans for land use in urban environments.

    Landscape Architect: Design outdoor spaces that harmonize with the natural environment.

    Project Manager: Oversee design projects from conception to completion.

Preparation Tips

    Practice Design Skills: Regularly work on design projects to build your skills.

    Build a Comprehensive Portfolio: Showcase a variety of projects reflecting your abilities.

    Seek Feedback: Get critiques from peers and mentors to enhance your work.

    Stay Informed: Keep up with design trends and industry developments.

    Network Actively: Join design communities and attend workshops to connect with professionals.

    Back

Fashion Design

Back

Semester 1

Semester 1 Subjects:

The first semester introduces the fundamentals of fashion design and textile understanding.

    Introduction to Fashion Design: Overview of fashion design principles and history.

    Textiles and Materials: Understanding different fabrics and their properties.

    Fashion Illustration: Techniques for illustrating fashion designs.

    Basic Sewing Techniques: Introduction to sewing and garment construction.

    Color Theory: Understanding color in relation to fashion and design.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Fashion Design Course: Principles, Practice, and Techniques by Steven Faerm

    The Fashion Book by Phaidon Press

    Textiles: A Handbook for Designers by George W. B. Palmer

YouTube Channels for Semester 1 Subjects:

    English: Fashion School Survival

    Hindi: Fashion Designing in Hindi

Semester 2

Semester 2 Subjects:

The second semester focuses on fashion history and advanced illustration techniques.

    Fashion History: Study of historical trends and movements in fashion.

    Advanced Fashion Illustration: Developing detailed fashion sketches.

    Pattern Making: Techniques for creating garment patterns.

    Garment Construction: Intermediate techniques for sewing and assembling garments.

    Fashion Marketing: Introduction to marketing strategies in the fashion industry.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Fashion: The Definitive History of Costume and Style by DK

    Patternmaking for Fashion Design by Helen Joseph-Armstrong

    The Fashion System by Roland Barthes

YouTube Channels for Semester 2 Subjects:

    English: Andrea Wong Fashion

    Hindi: Fashion Designing Tutorials

Semester 3

Semester 3 Subjects:

The third semester delves into draping techniques and fashion technology.

    Draping Techniques: Techniques for draping fabrics on dress forms.

    Fashion Technology: Overview of technology's impact on fashion design.

    Fashion Forecasting: Understanding trends and predicting future fashion.

    Creative Thinking in Fashion: Techniques to enhance creativity in design.

    Sustainable Fashion: Principles and practices in sustainable design.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Draping for Fashion Design by Hilde Jaffe

    Sustainable Fashion and Textiles: Design Journeys by Kate Fletcher

    The New Garment Industry: A Complete Handbook by Thomas M. Davis

YouTube Channels for Semester 3 Subjects:

    English: Fashion Forward

    Hindi: Hindi Fashion School

Semester 4

Semester 4 Subjects:

The fourth semester focuses on design projects and portfolio development.

    Design Project I: Developing a personal design project.

    Fashion Branding: Understanding brand development in fashion.

    Advanced Pattern Making: Complex pattern drafting techniques.

    Fashion Business Management: Basics of managing a fashion business.

    Fashion Show Production: Organizing and producing fashion events.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Fashion Branding and Communication by A. E. C. D. Johnson

    Fashion Business: Theory, Practice, and Skills by Paul Hargrave

    Fashion Show: A Guide to Planning and Production by Anne C. H. Ketcham

YouTube Channels for Semester 4 Subjects:

    English: Fashion Design Workshops

    Hindi: Fashion in Hindi

Semester 5

Semester 5 Subjects:

The fifth semester emphasizes advanced design concepts and project work.

    Design Project II: Expanding on your previous design project.

    Fashion Styling: Techniques for styling fashion collections.

    Fashion Photography: Basics of fashion photography and presentation.

    Textile Science: In-depth study of textile properties and applications.

    Global Fashion Markets: Understanding fashion markets and international trends.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Fashion Photography: The Story in 180 Pictures by Bruce Weber

    Textiles and Fashion: Materials, Techniques, and Industry by Rose Sinclair

    Fashion Marketing: Contemporary Issues by Tony Hines

YouTube Channels for Semester 5 Subjects:

    English: Fashion Insights

    Hindi: Hindi Fashion Trends

Semester 6

Semester 6 Subjects:

The sixth semester focuses on design development and market analysis.

    Capstone Project I: Initiating a comprehensive design project.

    Market Research: Techniques for conducting market analysis.

    Fashion Law: Understanding legal aspects of the fashion industry.

    Digital Fashion: Introduction to digital design tools and technologies.

    Fashion Trend Analysis: Analyzing and interpreting fashion trends.

Recommended Reference Books:

    The Fashion Law: A Legal Guide to the Fashion Industry by Jennifer M. W. Lee

    Fashion Marketing: Strategy, Branding, and Promotion by Richard B. Brunner

    Digital Fashion: How Technology is Changing the Industry by Amanda Smith

    Hindi: Fashion Design in Hindi

Semester 7

Semester 7 Subjects:

The seventh semester is dedicated to advanced projects and industry practices.

    Capstone Project II: Completing your major design project.

    Fashion Entrepreneurship: Developing business ideas in fashion.

    Ethics in Fashion: Exploring ethical issues in the fashion industry.

    Fashion Retail Management: Understanding retail strategies in fashion.

    Fashion Technology Trends: Exploring current technologies in fashion design.

    Fashion Entrepreneurship: Retail Business Planning by Daphne W. W. M. S. Wong

    The Business of Fashion: Designing, Manufacturing, and Marketing by Leslie Davis Burns

    Fashion Retailing: A Multi-Channel Approach by Ellen Diamond
