    English: Fashion Business

    Hindi: Hindi Fashion Business

Semester 8

Semester 8 Subjects:

The eighth semester culminates in final project presentations and career preparation.

    Final Capstone Presentation: Present your completed capstone project.

    Portfolio Development: Finalizing your portfolio for job applications.

    Job Search Strategies: Techniques for finding and applying for fashion jobs.

    Networking in Fashion: Building connections within the fashion industry.

    Career Preparation: Preparing for interviews and freelance opportunities.

Recommended Reference Books:

    The Complete Fashion Sketchbook by Steven Faerm

    Creating a Portfolio: The Essential Guide to Portfolio Development by Andrea Marks

    Design Your Future: 150+ Ideas for Your Career in Fashion by Michael A. S. Henderson

YouTube Channels for Semester 8 Subjects:

    English: Fashion Sketches

    Hindi: Fashion Resources Hindi

Future Paths

    Fashion Designer: Create clothing and accessory designs for the fashion industry.

    Fashion Stylist: Develop looks for models, photoshoots, or fashion shows.

    Textile Designer: Design textiles and fabrics for fashion and interiors.

    Fashion Merchandiser: Manage the marketing and sales of fashion products.

    Costume Designer: Design costumes for film, theater, or television.

Preparation Tips

    Practice Design Skills: Regularly work on personal design projects.

    Build a Comprehensive Portfolio: Showcase a variety of fashion designs and projects.

    Stay Updated: Keep up with the latest fashion trends and industry news.

    Network Actively: Join fashion communities and attend events to connect with professionals.

    Seek Feedback: Get critiques from peers and mentors to improve your work.

Bachelor of Business Administration(BBA) Courses

  • Financial Accounting
  • Managerial Accounting
  • Business Law
  • Economics of Management
  • Macroeconomics
  • Marketing Management
  • Financial Management
  • Human Resource Management
  • Operations Management
  • Business Ethics
  • Entrepreneurship
  • Organizational Behavior
  • Strategic Management
  • International Business

Financial Accounting

Back

Semester 1

Semester 1 Subjects:

In the first semester, you will be introduced to the basics of financial accounting, focusing on understanding the core concepts of accounting and bookkeeping.

    Introduction to Accounting: Basic concepts of accounting, types of accounts, and the accounting cycle.

    Principles of Double-Entry Bookkeeping: Rules of debit and credit, recording transactions, and maintaining ledgers.

    Financial Statements: Preparation of financial statements like balance sheet, income statement, and cash flow statements.

    Business Law: Overview of legal aspects related to financial accounting and business operations.

    Cost Accounting: Introduction to cost accounting, cost control, and management.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Accounting Principles by Jerry Weygandt

    Cost Accounting by Charles T. Horngren

YouTube Channels for Semester 1 Subjects:

    English: NPTEL - Financial Accounting

    Hindi: Commerce Adda

Semester 2

Semester 2 Subjects:

In the second semester, you will deepen your understanding of accounting with advanced concepts and applications in various financial domains.

    Advanced Financial Accounting: Accounting for partnerships, joint ventures, and non-profit organizations.

    Corporate Accounting: Concepts related to company accounts, share capital, and financial disclosures.

    Auditing: Basics of auditing, audit planning, and reporting.

    Taxation: Introduction to direct and indirect taxes, income tax, and GST.

    Financial Markets: Understanding of financial institutions, stock markets, and securities.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Advanced Financial Accounting by David Alexander

    Auditing by Alvin A. Arens

YouTube Channels for Semester 2 Subjects:

    English: Raj Accountancy

    Hindi: Khan Academy India

Semester 3

Semester 3 Subjects:

The third semester focuses on more complex accounting scenarios, such as international accounting standards and managerial accounting principles.

    International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS): Introduction to IFRS, accounting standards, and compliance.

    Managerial Accounting: Budgeting, performance evaluation, and decision-making processes in management accounting.

    Financial Statement Analysis: Analysis of balance sheets, income statements, and key financial ratios.

    Investment Analysis: Understanding of financial instruments, risk, and portfolio management.

    Business Economics: Economic concepts that influence accounting decisions, such as supply-demand and market structures.

Recommended Reference Books:

    IFRS Explained by BPP Learning Media

    Managerial Accounting by Ray H. Garrison

YouTube Channels for Semester 3 Subjects:

    English: Accounting Lectures

    Hindi: Learn Accountancy

Semester 4

Semester 4 Subjects:

In the fourth semester, the focus will shift to advanced areas of accounting and finance, including specialized topics and regulatory frameworks.

    Corporate Governance: Study of corporate policies, governance structures, and legal regulations.

    Risk Management and Insurance: Understanding financial risks, insurance, and risk mitigation strategies.

    Public Sector Accounting: Accounting practices for government and non-profit entities.

    Financial Planning: Basics of financial planning, personal finance, and retirement planning.

    Forensic Accounting: Fraud detection, forensic audits, and accounting for legal disputes.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Corporate Governance by Christine Mallin

    Risk Management and Insurance by Scott Harrington

YouTube Channels for Semester 4 Subjects:

    English: Accounting Coach

    Hindi: Study with Anil

Semester 5

Semester 5 Subjects:

The fifth semester will cover topics related to corporate finance, strategic financial management, and advanced auditing techniques.

    Strategic Financial Management: Financial strategy, capital budgeting, and mergers and acquisitions.

    Advanced Auditing: In-depth auditing techniques, risk assessment, and compliance audits.

    Financial Modeling: Techniques for creating financial models, forecasting, and valuation.

    Banking and Financial Services: Overview of banking operations, financial services, and regulations.

    Business Analytics for Accountants: Using data analysis tools for accounting and decision-making.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Strategic Financial Management by Prasanna Chandra

    Financial Modeling by Simon Benninga

YouTube Channels for Semester 5 Subjects:

    English: Learn With Me

    Hindi: Ashish Accounting

Semester 6

Semester 6 Subjects:

In the final semester, you will explore specialized areas of finance and accounting, focusing on professional skills and project work.

    Tax Planning and Management: Advanced tax strategies, corporate tax planning, and compliance.

    International Accounting: Cross-border accounting practices, currency exchange, and global standards.

    Entrepreneurial Finance: Finance for startups, venture capital, and growth management.

    Project Work: Comprehensive financial accounting project focusing on real-world applications.

Recommended Reference Books:

    International Accounting by Timothy Doupnik

    Tax Planning by P. V. Subramanyam

YouTube Channels for Semester 6 Subjects:

    English: Finance Guru

    Hindi: Mukesh Finance

Future Career Paths

After completing a course in Financial Accounting, various career paths open up. Below are some key options:

    Chartered Accountant (CA): Pursue further studies and certification to become a licensed Chartered Accountant.

    Certified Public Accountant (CPA): Obtain international certification as a CPA to work globally.

    Financial Analyst: Work as a financial analyst, analyzing financial data and providing insights to businesses.

    Auditor: Pursue a career in auditing, either with private firms or public organizations.

    Corporate Finance: Work in corporate finance departments, managing financial planning and analysis for companies.

Preparation Tips

To succeed in financial accounting, follow these preparation tips:

    Regular Study: Make a habit of regular study and practice accounting problems daily to strengthen your fundamentals.

    Stay Updated with Standards: Keep up-to-date with new developments in IFRS, GAAP, and other accounting standards.

    Practice with Real-World Examples: Use case studies and real-world scenarios to understand the application of accounting principles.

    Use Online Resources: Utilize online courses, YouTube channels, and forums to clarify doubts and learn new topics.

    Mock Tests and Past Papers: Regularly solve mock tests and past question papers to prepare for exams effectively.

    Back

Managerial Accounting

Back

Semester 1

Semester 1 Subjects:

Managerial Accounting involves the application of accounting information to help managers within organizations make informed business decisions.

    Cost Behavior: Understanding fixed, variable, and mixed costs, and how they affect business decisions.

    Cost-Volume-Profit (CVP) Analysis: Analyzing how changes in costs and volume affect a company’s profit.

    Budgeting: Developing budgets as a financial plan and controlling tool for organizations.

    Standard Costing and Variance Analysis: Setting cost standards and analyzing variances between actual and standard costs.

    Responsibility Accounting: Creating performance reports and holding managers accountable for their departments.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Managerial Accounting by Ray H. Garrison

    Cost Management by Blocher and Stout

YouTube Channels for Semester 1 Subjects:

    English: NPTEL - Managerial Accounting

    Hindi: Commerce Adda

Semester 2

Semester 2 Subjects:

In the second semester, the focus is on advanced managerial accounting techniques and their application in real-world scenarios.

    Activity-Based Costing (ABC): Allocating overhead costs more accurately by focusing on activities that drive costs.

    Job Order Costing: Tracking costs for individual jobs or batches to determine profitability.

    Capital Budgeting: Evaluating investment opportunities using techniques like NPV, IRR, and payback period.

    Segment Reporting: Reporting financial performance by business segments for better decision-making.

    Transfer Pricing: Setting prices for transactions between divisions of the same company to optimize performance.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Activity-Based Costing and Management by Kaplan and Cooper

    Advanced Managerial Accounting by Ronald Hilton

YouTube Channels for Semester 2 Subjects:

    English: Raj Accountancy

    Hindi: Khan Academy India

Future Career Paths

After completing a course in Managerial Accounting, several career options open up in the field of finance and business management:

    Management Accountant: Provide financial insights to help companies manage their operations efficiently.

    Financial Controller: Oversee financial reporting, budgeting, and cost control within an organization.

    Cost Analyst: Specialize in analyzing cost data to find opportunities for cost savings and operational efficiency.

    Budget Analyst: Assist in preparing and managing financial budgets for organizations, analyzing trends and performance.

    Internal Auditor: Assess internal processes and controls to ensure compliance and operational effectiveness.

Preparation Tips

To excel in Managerial Accounting, follow these preparation tips:

    Understand Costing Concepts: Spend time mastering different costing methods like ABC, job order costing, and standard costing.

    Practice Financial Analysis: Regularly practice interpreting financial statements and performing ratio analysis.

    Use Case Studies: Apply your knowledge by working through real-world case studies that involve managerial accounting decisions.

    Stay Current with Trends: Keep updated on evolving trends in cost management, budgeting, and performance measurement.

    Group Discussions: Collaborate with classmates to discuss complex problems and share insights on managerial decision-making.

    Back

Business Law

Back

Semester 1

Semester 1 Subjects:

Business Law covers the laws and regulations that govern the business environment. It focuses on the legal frameworks that impact companies and individuals in the business world.

    Contract Law: Learn the basics of contracts, including the formation, performance, and breach of contracts.

    Company Law: Understanding the formation, management, and regulation of companies, including directors' duties and shareholders' rights.

    Sales of Goods Act: Study laws governing the sale and purchase of goods and the rights of buyers and sellers.

    Consumer Protection Law: Explore laws designed to protect consumers against unfair trade practices.

    Negotiable Instruments Act: Study legal instruments like promissory notes, bills of exchange, and cheques used in trade.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Business Law by N.D. Kapoor

    Elements of Mercantile Law by Avtar Singh

YouTube Channels for Semester 1 Subjects:

    English: BBA Tutorials

    Hindi: Lecwise

Semester 2

Semester 2 Subjects:

In the second semester, the focus shifts to more specialized areas of business law and its practical application in modern businesses.

    Partnership Law: Understand the rights and obligations of partners in a business and the dissolution of partnerships.

    Intellectual Property Rights (IPR): Learn about copyright, trademark, patent law, and how they protect businesses and innovations.

    Environmental Law: Study laws related to the environment and their impact on businesses, including pollution control and sustainability practices.

    Labour Law: Understand the legal framework governing employment, including wages, work hours, and employee rights.

    Cyber Law: Examine laws relating to digital transactions, online security, and the regulation of e-commerce.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Intellectual Property Rights by P. Narayanan

    Cyber Law by Pavan Duggal

YouTube Channels for Semester 2 Subjects:

    English: NPTEL - Business Law

    Hindi: Commerce Adda

Future Career Paths

Business Law graduates have a wide array of career opportunities in legal and business environments:

    Corporate Lawyer: Specialize in advising businesses on their legal rights, responsibilities, and obligations.

    Legal Advisor: Provide expert legal counsel to organizations on a variety of business-related legal issues.

    Compliance Officer: Ensure that companies operate within the legal framework and adhere to regulations and standards.

    Contract Manager: Draft, review, and manage business contracts, ensuring they meet legal requirements and protect business interests.

    Intellectual Property Consultant: Help companies protect their intellectual property through legal counsel on patents, copyrights, and trademarks.

Preparation Tips

Here are some tips to excel in Business Law:

    Understand Key Concepts: Focus on understanding legal principles, especially those governing contracts, companies, and sales law.

    Case Law Studies: Regularly review important case laws and judicial precedents to gain insights into practical legal applications.

    Mock Trials and Moot Courts: Participate in mock trials and moot courts to enhance your litigation and public speaking skills.

    Stay Updated on Legal Changes: Business laws are dynamic, so keep yourself updated with new amendments and rulings.

    Group Discussions and Debates: Engage in debates on legal issues and group discussions to improve critical thinking and articulation.

Economics of Management

Back

Semester 1

Semester 1 Subjects:

Economics of Management focuses on applying economic theories and principles to solve managerial problems, improve decision-making, and optimize resource allocation in businesses.

    Microeconomics: Study the behavior of individual consumers, firms, and the interaction of supply and demand in markets.

    Managerial Decision Making: Learn how economic principles are applied to make rational business decisions, considering costs, revenues, and profits.

    Demand and Supply Analysis: Analyze demand patterns and understand how businesses can optimize their production based on supply constraints.

    Market Structures: Understand different market structures (monopoly, oligopoly, and perfect competition) and their implications for business strategy.

    Cost-Volume-Profit Analysis: Study the relationship between costs, production volumes, and profits to guide managerial decisions.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Managerial Economics by William F. Samuelson

    Microeconomics for Managers by David M. Kreps

YouTube Channels for Semester 1 Subjects:

    English: NPTEL - Managerial Economics

    Hindi: Study with SP

Semester 2

Semester 2 Subjects:

In the second semester, the focus shifts to more macroeconomic concepts and their impact on business decision-making and strategy.

    Macroeconomics: Study the performance of the economy as a whole, including inflation, unemployment, and economic growth.

    National Income Accounting: Learn how the income and output of an economy are measured and how businesses fit into the larger economic picture.

    Business Cycles: Understand the fluctuations in economic activity over time and how businesses can prepare for recessions and expansions.

    Inflation and Unemployment: Analyze the causes and effects of inflation and unemployment on business operations.

    Government Policy and Business: Explore the impact of government policies like fiscal and monetary policies on business strategies and the economy at large.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Macroeconomics by N. Gregory Mankiw

    Managerial Economics and Business Strategy by Michael Baye

YouTube Channels for Semester 2 Subjects:

    English: Mrunal - Economics

    Hindi: Lectures4Economics

Semester 3

Semester 3 Subjects:

In Semester 3, the course delves deeper into managerial applications of economics with a focus on advanced topics.

    Game Theory: Learn how managers can use game theory to anticipate competitors' moves and make strategic decisions.

    Pricing Strategies: Study how firms set prices to maximize profits based on market conditions and consumer behavior.

    Risk Analysis and Uncertainty: Understand how businesses deal with uncertainty and risk in decision-making processes.

    Cost-Benefit Analysis: Learn how to weigh the costs and benefits of different business initiatives to choose the best course of action.

    Advanced Market Structures: Analyze the behavior of firms in oligopolies and monopolistic competition.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Game Theory for Business by Paul Papayoanou

    Managerial Economics by Ivan Png

YouTube Channels for Semester 3 Subjects:

    English: Edspira

    Hindi: Indian Economics

Semester 4

Semester 4 Subjects:

In the final semester, the focus is on global economic issues and how they affect management practices.

    International Trade: Explore the economic principles that govern international trade, tariffs, and trade agreements.

    Foreign Exchange Markets: Understand how currency markets function and how exchange rates affect business decisions.

    Globalization and Business: Study how globalization impacts firms, particularly multinational companies.

    Public Economics: Learn about the role of government in the economy, including taxation and public spending.

    Economics of Sustainability: Study the economic challenges of environmental sustainability and resource management for businesses.

Recommended Reference Books:

    International Economics by Paul Krugman

    Globalization and its Discontents by Joseph Stiglitz

YouTube Channels for Semester 4 Subjects:

    English: EconplusDal

    Hindi: Exam Time with Angad Verma

Future Career Paths

Economics of Management offers diverse career opportunities in various sectors:

    Business Consultant: Use economic principles to advise companies on growth strategies and market behavior.

    Market Analyst: Analyze market trends and consumer behavior to help businesses make informed decisions.

    Financial Analyst: Use economic models to assess business investments and financial performance.

    Policy Analyst: Work for government or think tanks to analyze the impact of economic policies on businesses and the economy.

    Risk Manager: Help companies identify, assess, and mitigate risks using economic tools and analysis.

Preparation Tips

Here are some tips to excel in Economics of Management:

    Grasp Economic Theories: Focus on understanding economic concepts and models rather than just memorizing them.

    Apply Real-World Scenarios: Relate theories to real-world business cases to see their practical implications.

    Stay Updated with Economic News: Follow the latest economic trends, government policies, and market behavior.

    Practice with Case Studies: Work on case studies that involve decision-making using economic principles.

    Group Studies: Discuss complex topics with peers to gain new perspectives and better understanding.

    Back

Macroeconomics

Back

Semester 1

Semester 1 Subjects:

Macroeconomics focuses on the overall functioning of the economy and how various factors impact economic performance.

    Introduction to Macroeconomics: Understand basic concepts, definitions, and the significance of macroeconomic studies.

    Measurement of Economic Performance: Learn how to measure GDP, unemployment rates, and inflation.

    Aggregate Demand and Supply: Analyze the aggregate demand and supply model and its implications for the economy.

    Business Cycles: Study the phases of business cycles and their impact on economic stability.

    Fiscal Policy: Explore the role of government spending and taxation in influencing economic performance.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Macroeconomics by N. Gregory Mankiw

    Principles of Economics by Alfred Marshall

YouTube Channels for Semester 1 Subjects:

    English: Khan Academy - Macroeconomics

    Hindi: Tiwari Academy

Semester 2

Semester 2 Subjects:

The second semester dives deeper into macroeconomic theories and their applications in real-world scenarios.

    Monetary Policy: Study how central banks manage money supply and interest rates to influence the economy.

    Inflation and Unemployment: Analyze the relationship between inflation and unemployment, including the Phillips curve.

    Economic Growth: Explore the factors that contribute to economic growth and the policies that promote it.

    Open Economy Macroeconomics: Learn about international trade, exchange rates, and their effects on the domestic economy.

    Macroeconomic Models: Understand different macroeconomic models, including IS-LM and AD-AS models.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Macroeconomics: Principles, Problems, and Policies by Campbell R. McConnell

    Macroeconomic Theory by Durbarry and Ramchandran

YouTube Channels for Semester 2 Subjects:

    English: Jacob Claudia - Macroeconomics

    Hindi: Academic Foundation

Semester 3

Semester 3 Subjects:

This semester focuses on advanced macroeconomic theories and their applications in economic policies.

    Advanced Macroeconomic Theory: Study advanced theories in macroeconomics, including endogenous growth theory.

    Business Cycle Theories: Analyze different theories explaining the causes of business cycles.

    Macroeconomic Policy Analysis: Understand the effects of fiscal and monetary policies on the economy.

    Global Economic Issues: Discuss issues such as global warming, inequality, and their macroeconomic implications.

    Behavioral Macroeconomics: Explore how psychological factors influence economic decisions and outcomes.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Advanced Macroeconomics by David Romer

    Macroeconomics by Olivier Blanchard

YouTube Channels for Semester 3 Subjects:

    English: Marginal Revolution University

    Hindi: Econ Videos

Semester 4

Semester 4 Subjects:

The final semester examines the role of macroeconomic policies in shaping national and global economies.

    International Macroeconomics: Study macroeconomic theories in the context of international markets and economies.

    Economic Development: Explore the factors that contribute to economic development in different countries.

    Macroeconomic Forecasting: Learn techniques for forecasting macroeconomic variables and trends.

    Environmental Economics: Analyze the economic impact of environmental policies and sustainability.

    Policy Simulation: Engage in simulations to understand the impact of various macroeconomic policies on economic outcomes.

Recommended Reference Books:

    International Macroeconomics by Mario J. Crucini

    The Economics of Climate Change by Nicholas Stern

YouTube Channels for Semester 4 Subjects:

    English: Economics Explained

    Hindi: UPSC Preparation

Future Career Paths

Studying Macroeconomics opens various career opportunities:

    Economist: Analyze data and trends to provide insights and predictions about economic conditions.

    Financial Analyst: Use macroeconomic indicators to inform investment decisions and financial planning.

    Policy Advisor: Work with government agencies or NGOs to develop and analyze economic policies.

    Researcher: Conduct research in academic or private institutions focusing on macroeconomic issues.

    Data Analyst: Analyze economic data and provide actionable insights for businesses and governments.

Preparation Tips

Here are some tips to excel in Macroeconomics:

    Understand Key Concepts: Focus on mastering key macroeconomic concepts and their interrelations.

    Practice Problem-Solving: Work on numerical problems to strengthen your understanding of economic models.

    Stay Informed: Keep up with current events and economic news to relate theory to practice.

    Engage in Discussions: Participate in study groups or forums to discuss and clarify complex topics.

    Review Past Papers: Practice with past exam papers to familiarize yourself with the question formats.

    Back

Marketing Management

Back

Semester 1

Semester 1 Subjects:

The first semester introduces fundamental marketing concepts and principles.

    Introduction to Marketing: Understand the basics of marketing, its significance, and its role in business.

    Market Research: Learn about various research methodologies and how to gather and analyze market data.

    Consumer Behavior: Study the factors influencing consumer purchasing decisions and behavior.

    Marketing Mix: Explore the 4Ps (Product, Price, Place, Promotion) and how they impact marketing strategies.

    Brand Management: Understand the importance of branding and strategies for building strong brands.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Marketing Management by Philip Kotler

    Principles of Marketing by Gary Armstrong

YouTube Channels for Semester 1 Subjects:

    English: Marketing91

    Hindi: Hindustan Times

Semester 2

Semester 2 Subjects:

This semester focuses on advanced marketing strategies and concepts.

    Digital Marketing: Explore online marketing channels, tools, and techniques.

    Sales Management: Study the processes and strategies involved in effective sales management.

    Marketing Strategy: Learn how to develop and implement effective marketing strategies.

    Advertising and Promotion: Understand the role of advertising and promotional strategies in marketing.

    International Marketing: Analyze marketing strategies in a global context.

    Digital Marketing by Dave Chaffey

    Sales Management: Analysis and Decision Making by John F. Tanner

    Hindi: Amit Bhadana

Semester 3 Subjects:

This semester examines the integration of marketing with other business functions.

    Integrated Marketing Communications: Study how to create a unified marketing message across different channels.

    Product Development and Management: Explore the stages of product development and effective management practices.

    Customer Relationship Management: Understand strategies for building and maintaining customer relationships.

    Retail Management: Analyze retail strategies and the role of retailing in the marketing mix.

    Service Marketing: Explore marketing strategies specific to service-oriented businesses.

    Customer Relationship Management by Francis Buttle

    Hindi: Sandeep Maheshwari

Semester 4

Semester 4 Subjects:

The final semester emphasizes strategic marketing and the future of marketing management.

    Strategic Marketing: Develop and implement long-term marketing strategies.

    Marketing Analytics: Learn how to use data analysis to inform marketing decisions.

    Ethics in Marketing: Discuss the ethical considerations in marketing practices.

    Emerging Trends in Marketing: Explore trends such as sustainability, social media, and influencer marketing.

    Capstone Project: Apply learned concepts in a real-world marketing project.

    Strategic Marketing by David W. Cravens

    Hindi: Economic Times

Future Career Paths

Studying Marketing Management opens various career opportunities:

    Marketing Manager: Oversee marketing strategies and campaigns for an organization.

    Brand Manager: Manage and develop a brand's identity and market presence.

    Market Research Analyst: Analyze market trends and consumer behavior to inform strategies.

    Digital Marketing Specialist: Focus on online marketing strategies and campaigns.

    Sales Executive: Drive sales through effective communication and marketing strategies.

Preparation Tips

Here are some tips to excel in Marketing Management:

    Understand Market Dynamics: Study how market conditions affect consumer behavior and business strategies.

    Stay Updated on Trends: Keep abreast of the latest trends in marketing and consumer preferences.

    Network with Professionals: Attend marketing seminars and networking events to connect with industry professionals.

    Work on Projects: Engage in practical projects to apply theoretical knowledge in real-world situations.

    Practice Analytical Skills: Enhance your ability to analyze data and make informed decisions based on marketing metrics.

Financial Management

Back

Semester 1

Semester 1 Subjects:

The first semester introduces foundational concepts in financial management.

    Introduction to Financial Management: Understand the role of finance in business and the key financial concepts.

    Financial Statement Analysis: Learn how to analyze financial statements to assess the financial health of a company.

    Time Value of Money: Explore the concepts of present and future value of money and their applications.

    Capital Budgeting: Study the techniques for evaluating investment projects and capital expenditure decisions.

    Risk and Return: Understand the relationship between risk and expected return on investments.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Financial Management by Eugene F. Brigham

    Essentials of Financial Management by Pandey I.M.

YouTube Channels for Semester 1 Subjects:

    English: Investopedia

    Hindi: Study IQ Education

Semester 2

Semester 2 Subjects:

This semester focuses on advanced financial management topics.

    Working Capital Management: Learn the principles and practices of managing a company's short-term assets and liabilities.

    Financial Markets and Institutions: Study the functioning of financial markets and the role of financial institutions.

    Cost of Capital: Understand the concept of cost of capital and its importance in financial decision-making.

    Dividend Policy: Explore the factors influencing dividend decisions and different dividend policies.

    Financial Forecasting: Learn techniques for forecasting financial performance and planning.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Financial Management by I.M. Pandey

    Corporate Finance by Stephen A. Ross

YouTube Channels for Semester 2 Subjects:

    English: Khan Academy

    Hindi: NPTEL HRD

Semester 3

Semester 3 Subjects:

This semester examines financial analysis and investment decisions.

    Investment Analysis and Portfolio Management: Study different investment options and how to create and manage an investment portfolio.

    Financial Derivatives: Understand the various types of financial derivatives and their applications in risk management.

    Behavioral Finance: Explore the psychological influences on investor behavior and decision-making.

    International Financial Management: Analyze the challenges and strategies of managing finance in an international context.

    Financial Risk Management: Learn about identifying, analyzing, and mitigating financial risks.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Investments by Zvi Bodie

    Options, Futures, and Other Derivatives by John C. Hull

YouTube Channels for Semester 3 Subjects:

    English: The Finance Story

    Hindi: FinTalk

Semester 4

Semester 4 Subjects:

The final semester emphasizes strategic financial management and corporate finance.

    Corporate Financial Strategy: Understand how to develop and implement financial strategies in corporations.

    Mergers and Acquisitions: Study the processes, valuation, and implications of mergers and acquisitions.

    Financial Planning and Control: Learn about budgeting, forecasting, and performance measurement.

    Ethics in Finance: Discuss the ethical issues and responsibilities in financial management.

    Capstone Project: Apply learned concepts in a practical financial management project.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Corporate Finance by Jonathan Berk

    Financial Planning and Analysis by Jack Alexander

YouTube Channels for Semester 4 Subjects:

    English: CFA Institute

    Hindi: CA Final Exam

Future Career Paths

Studying Financial Management opens various career opportunities:

    Financial Manager: Oversee financial activities and guide investment decisions.

    Investment Analyst: Analyze financial data and investment opportunities for organizations.

    Risk Manager: Identify and manage financial risks within an organization.

    Corporate Finance Analyst: Provide financial analysis and support for corporate decision-making.

    Financial Consultant: Advise clients on financial planning, investments, and risk management.

Preparation Tips

Here are some tips to excel in Financial Management:

    Master Financial Concepts: Ensure a strong understanding of core financial principles and concepts.

    Practice Financial Analysis: Regularly analyze financial statements and perform ratio analysis.

    Stay Informed on Market Trends: Keep abreast of market trends and economic indicators affecting finance.

    Engage in Case Studies: Participate in case studies to apply theoretical knowledge to real-world scenarios.

    Network with Professionals: Attend finance seminars and workshops to connect with industry experts.

    Employee Relations Manager: Manage employee relations and resolve workplace conflicts.

    Organizational Development Consultant: Advise organizations on improving performance and culture.

    Understand HR Fundamentals: Master core HR concepts and practices.

    Stay Updated on Employment Laws: Keep abreast of local and international labor laws.

    Develop Interpersonal Skills: Enhance communication and relationship-building skills.

    Engage in Practical Experience: Participate in internships or HR projects for real-world experience.

    Network with HR Professionals: Join HR associations and attend workshops to connect with industry leaders.

    Operations Strategy: Explore how operations strategy aligns with overall business strategy.

    Supply Chain Management: Understand the components and management of supply chains.

    Lean Manufacturing: Understand principles of lean practices to enhance efficiency.

    Project Management: Study techniques for planning, executing, and closing projects effectively.

    Logistics Manager: Plan and coordinate logistics and transportation activities.

    Project Manager: Lead projects from initiation to completion, ensuring timely delivery.

    Engage in Practical Learning: Participate in internships or projects to gain hands-on experience.

    Stay Updated on Industry Trends: Keep abreast of the latest developments in operations and supply chain management.

    Develop Analytical Skills: Enhance your ability to analyze data for informed decision-making.

    Network with Industry Professionals: Join professional organizations and attend conferences to expand your network.

Back

Semester 1

Semester 1 Subjects:

The first semester introduces foundational concepts in business ethics.

    Introduction to Business Ethics: Understand the importance of ethics in business practices.

    Theoretical Frameworks of Ethics: Explore different ethical theories and their application in business.

    Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR): Study the role of businesses in societal welfare.

    Ethical Decision Making: Learn about frameworks for making ethical decisions in business.

    Global Business Ethics: Examine ethical issues in the context of international business.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Business Ethics: Concepts and Cases by Manuel G. Velasquez

    Ethics in the Workplace by Craig E. Johnson

    Hindi: Chetan Kumar

Semester 2 Subjects:

    Business Ethics in Practice: Analyze real-world case studies of ethical dilemmas in business.

    Ethics and Compliance Programs: Understand the importance of compliance in business ethics.

    Environmental Ethics: Explore ethical considerations regarding environmental sustainability.

    Ethics in Marketing: Study ethical issues in marketing practices and consumer protection.

    Whistleblowing and Ethics: Learn about the implications of whistleblowing in organizations.

    Ethics in Finance: Examine ethical considerations in financial practices and regulations.

    Labor and Employment Ethics: Study ethical issues related to labor rights and workplace ethics.

    Technology and Ethics: Explore ethical challenges posed by technological advancements.

    Ethical Leadership: Understand the role of ethical leadership in organizations.

    International Business Ethics: Analyze ethical practices in the global business environment.

    Corporate Governance and Ethics: Study the role of governance in ensuring ethical conduct in organizations.

    Ethics Training and Development: Explore best practices for training employees on ethics.

    Future Trends in Business Ethics: Investigate emerging trends and challenges in business ethics.

Future Career Paths

    Ethics Compliance Officer: Ensure adherence to ethical standards and regulations within organizations.

    Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) Manager: Oversee CSR initiatives and strategies.

    Ethics Consultant: Advise organizations on ethical practices and policies.

    Corporate Governance Specialist: Focus on governance practices to ensure ethical conduct.

    Business Analyst with Ethical Focus: Analyze business practices through an ethical lens.

Preparation Tips

Here are some tips to excel in Business Ethics:

    Familiarize with Ethical Frameworks: Understand various ethical theories and how they apply to business.

    Engage in Discussions: Participate in debates and discussions to explore ethical dilemmas.

    Stay Updated on Regulations: Keep informed about laws and regulations related to business ethics.

    Analyze Case Studies: Study real-world ethical dilemmas to enhance analytical skills.

    Network with Professionals: Join ethics-related organizations and attend workshops and seminars.

    Introduction to Entrepreneurship: Understand the role of entrepreneurs in the economy.

    Entrepreneurial Mindset: Develop the mindset and skills needed for entrepreneurship.

    Opportunity Recognition: Learn how to identify and evaluate business opportunities.

    Business Models and Strategies: Explore different business models and strategies for startups.

    Financing the New Venture: Explore funding options and financial management for startups.

    Marketing Strategies for Entrepreneurs: Understand how to market new products and services.

    Entrepreneurial Leadership: Study leadership styles and their impact on business success.

    Entrepreneurial Networking: Learn the importance of networking in entrepreneurship.

    Risk Management for Entrepreneurs: Identify and manage risks associated with starting and running a business.

    Startup Founder: Launch and manage your own startup venture.

    Product Manager: Oversee the development and launch of new products.

    Social Entrepreneur: Create ventures focused on social impact and sustainability.

    Venture Capital Analyst: Evaluate and invest in startup companies.

Preparation Tips

Here are some tips to excel in Entrepreneurship:

    Develop a Business Plan: Practice writing business plans for various business ideas.

    Engage in Networking: Attend entrepreneurship events and meet fellow entrepreneurs.

    Stay Informed: Keep up with trends in the entrepreneurial landscape.

    Participate in Incubators: Join startup incubators or accelerators to gain hands-on experience.

    Learn from Failures: Analyze failed startups to understand what went wrong and learn from them.

Organizational Behavior

Back

Semester 1

Semester 1 Subjects:

The first semester introduces the fundamental concepts of organizational behavior.

    Introduction to Organizational Behavior: Study the basics of behavior within organizations.

    Individual Behavior: Learn about personality, perception, and attitudes in the workplace.

    Motivation Theories: Explore key motivation theories such as Maslow's hierarchy and Herzberg's two-factor theory.

    Communication in Organizations: Understand the role of effective communication in organizations.

    Decision-Making in Organizations: Study the processes involved in organizational decision-making.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Organizational Behavior by Stephen P. Robbins

    Motivation and Personality by Abraham Maslow

    Hindi: Ravi Kumar

    Group Behavior: Study how individuals behave in group settings within organizations.

    Teamwork and Collaboration: Understand the importance of teamwork and how to foster collaboration.

    Leadership Theories: Explore different leadership styles and their impact on organizations.

    Organizational Culture: Learn about the impact of organizational culture on employee behavior.

    Conflict Management: Study conflict resolution techniques within an organizational context.

    Power and Politics in Organizations: Understand the role of power and politics in shaping organizational behavior.

    Job Satisfaction and Employee Engagement: Learn about the factors that influence job satisfaction and employee engagement.

    Stress Management in Organizations: Study techniques for managing workplace stress.

    Future Trends in Organizational Behavior: Investigate the emerging trends shaping the future of organizational behavior.

    Human Resources Manager: Oversee employee relations, recruitment, and workplace policies.

    Organizational Development Consultant: Help organizations improve their efficiency and effectiveness.

    Change Management Specialist: Lead organizations through transitions and change initiatives.

    Leadership Coach: Guide executives and managers to become better leaders.

    Talent Management Specialist: Develop strategies to retain and develop talent within organizations.

Preparation Tips

Here are some tips to excel in Organizational Behavior:

    Analyze Case Studies: Read and analyze case studies on organizational behavior challenges and solutions.

    Improve Communication Skills: Strong communication is key to understanding and influencing organizational behavior.

    Develop Emotional Intelligence: Work on your emotional intelligence to manage workplace relationships effectively.

    Stay Current: Keep up with trends in workplace behavior, ethics, and leadership strategies.

    Participate in Workshops: Attend workshops and seminars on leadership, teamwork, and management skills.

Strategic Management

Back

Semester 1

Semester 1 Subjects:

The first semester introduces the fundamental concepts of strategic management.

    Introduction to Strategic Management: Overview of strategic management principles and frameworks.

    Business Environment Analysis: Study the external factors affecting organizations.

    Internal Environment Analysis: Assessing organizational strengths and weaknesses.

    Strategic Planning Process: Understanding how to formulate effective strategies.

    Competitive Advantage: Explore concepts related to gaining and sustaining competitive advantage.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Strategic Management: Concepts and Cases by Fred R. David

    The Art of Strategy by Avinash K. Dixit

YouTube Channels for Semester 1 Subjects:

    English: Strategic Management Academy

    Hindi: Ravi Kumar

Semester 2

Semester 2 Subjects:

This semester dives deeper into strategy formulation and implementation.

    Strategy Formulation: Learn about the frameworks for developing strategic plans.

    Business-Level Strategy: Explore different competitive strategies at the business level.

    Corporate-Level Strategy: Understand diversification and its strategic implications.

    Strategic Implementation: Study the processes involved in executing strategies effectively.

    Performance Measurement: Learn how to evaluate the success of strategic initiatives.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Exploring Corporate Strategy by Johnson, Scholes, and Whittington

    Good Strategy Bad Strategy by Richard Rumelt

YouTube Channels for Semester 2 Subjects:

    English: Strategic Leadership

    Hindi: Ankit Sharma

Semester 3

Semester 3 Subjects:

This semester focuses on strategic decision-making and the role of leadership.

    Strategic Decision-Making: Study the processes and tools for making strategic choices.

    Leadership in Strategy: Explore the impact of leadership on strategic direction.

    Innovation and Change Management: Learn about managing innovation and organizational change.

    Global Strategy: Understand the complexities of formulating strategies in a global context.

    Ethics and Social Responsibility: Discuss the ethical implications of strategic decisions.

Recommended Reference Books:

    The Innovator's Dilemma by Clayton M. Christensen

    Strategic Management: Theory and Practice by John A. Pearce and Richard B. Robinson

YouTube Channels for Semester 3 Subjects:

    English: Innovation Management

    Hindi: Shyam Gupta

Semester 4

Semester 4 Subjects:

The final semester covers advanced strategic management topics and future trends.

    Strategic Alliances and Mergers: Study the strategic implications of mergers and partnerships.

    Entrepreneurial Strategies: Explore strategies for new ventures and startups.

    Corporate Governance: Learn about the role of governance in strategic decision-making.

    Future Trends in Strategic Management: Investigate emerging trends and challenges in the field.

    Capstone Project: Apply knowledge through a strategic management project.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Competitive Strategy by Michael E. Porter

    Strategic Management: Concepts by Fred R. David and Forest R. David

YouTube Channels for Semester 4 Subjects:

    English: Corporate Strategy Insights

    Hindi: Kiran Singh

Future Career Paths

Studying Strategic Management opens up various career opportunities:

    Strategic Manager: Oversee the development and execution of strategic plans.

    Business Development Manager: Identify and pursue growth opportunities for the organization.

    Management Consultant: Provide strategic advice to organizations on improving performance.

    Chief Executive Officer (CEO): Lead the organization and make high-level strategic decisions.

    Corporate Strategist: Formulate and implement strategic initiatives within an organization.

Preparation Tips

Here are some tips to excel in Strategic Management:

    Understand Core Concepts: Familiarize yourself with strategic management theories and frameworks.

    Engage in Case Studies: Analyze real-world business cases to understand strategic decision-making.

    Network with Professionals: Connect with industry professionals to gain insights and mentorship.

    Participate in Simulations: Engage in strategy simulations to apply concepts in practical scenarios.

    Stay Updated: Follow industry trends and news to stay informed about changes in the business environment.

    Back

International Business

Back

Semester 1

Semester 1 Subjects:

The first semester introduces the fundamental concepts of international business.

    Introduction to International Business: Overview of global trade and its significance.

    Global Economic Environment: Understanding the international economic landscape.

    Cultural Environment in International Business: Exploring the impact of culture on business practices.

    International Trade Theories: Study different theories explaining international trade.

    International Business Regulations: Learn about laws and regulations governing international trade.

Recommended Reference Books:

    International Business: Competing in the Global Marketplace by Charles W. L. Hill

    Global Business by Mike W. Peng

YouTube Channels for Semester 1 Subjects:

    English: Global Business Insights

    Hindi: Amit Sharma

Semester 2

Semester 2 Subjects:

This semester explores international business strategies and operations.

    International Marketing: Learn strategies for marketing products in global markets.

    International Finance: Understand financial aspects of international business operations.

    Cross-Cultural Management: Study management practices across different cultures.

    International Business Strategy: Formulating strategies for international market entry.

    Supply Chain Management in Global Context: Explore global supply chain strategies and logistics.

Recommended Reference Books:

    International Marketing by Philip R. Cateora

    International Business: Strategy, Management, and the New Realities by Eiteman, Stonehill, and Moffett

YouTube Channels for Semester 2 Subjects:

    English: Global Marketing Strategies

    Hindi: Rohan Bansal

Semester 3

Semester 3 Subjects:

This semester focuses on global trade practices and legal aspects.

    International Trade Regulations: Study regulations and treaties affecting international trade.

    Foreign Direct Investment: Understand the role and impact of FDI in global business.

    Global Business Ethics: Explore ethical issues and corporate social responsibility in international business.

    International Negotiation and Conflict Resolution: Techniques for negotiation in a global context.

    Global Market Research: Methods for conducting research in international markets.

Recommended Reference Books:

    International Business Law and Its Environment by Richard Schaffer

    Global Business and International Economics by G. M. P. H. Robinson

YouTube Channels for Semester 3 Subjects:

    English: International Business Law

    Hindi: Ravi Kumar

Semester 4

Semester 4 Subjects:

The final semester covers advanced topics and real-world applications.

    Global Supply Chain Management: Managing supply chains across multiple countries.

    International Human Resource Management: Strategies for managing human resources globally.

    Emerging Markets: Study business opportunities and challenges in emerging economies.

    Capstone Project in International Business: A project applying international business concepts.

    Future Trends in International Business: Exploring future challenges and opportunities in the global market.

Recommended Reference Books:

    Global Operations and Logistics Management by J. A. M. T. B. Leenders

    International Business: The Challenges of Globalization by John J. Wild

YouTube Channels for Semester 4 Subjects:

    English: Global Operations Management

    Hindi: Ankit Sharma

Future Career Paths

Studying International Business opens up various career opportunities:

    International Business Manager: Oversee international operations and strategy.

    Global Marketing Manager: Develop marketing strategies for international markets.

    Import/Export Manager: Manage logistics and compliance for international trade.

    Foreign Affairs Analyst: Analyze international market trends and policies.

    Consultant for International Trade: Provide advisory services for global market entry.

Preparation Tips

Here are some tips to excel in International Business:

    Understand Global Markets: Study different markets and their economic conditions.

    Learn About Cultures: Familiarize yourself with cultural nuances and practices.

    Network Internationally: Build relationships with professionals from diverse backgrounds.

    Stay Informed: Keep up with global news and trends impacting international business.

    Gain Practical Experience: Pursue internships or projects related to international business.

    Back

International Business

Back

Semester 1

Semester 1 Subjects:

The first semester introduces the fundamental concepts of international business.

  • Introduction to International Business: Overview of global trade and its significance.
  • Global Economic Environment: Understanding the international economic landscape.
  • Cultural Environment in International Business: Exploring the impact of culture on business practices.
  • International Trade Theories: Study different theories explaining international trade.
  • International Business Regulations: Learn about laws and regulations governing international trade.

Recommended Reference Books:

  • International Business: Competing in the Global Marketplace by Charles W. L. Hill
  • Global Business by Mike W. Peng

YouTube Channels for Semester 1 Subjects:

  • English: Global Business Insights
  • Hindi: Amit Sharma

Semester 2

Semester 2 Subjects:

This semester explores international business strategies and operations.

  • International Marketing: Learn strategies for marketing products in global markets.
  • International Finance: Understand financial aspects of international business operations.
  • Cross-Cultural Management: Study management practices across different cultures.
  • International Business Strategy: Formulating strategies for international market entry.
  • Supply Chain Management in Global Context: Explore global supply chain strategies and logistics.

Recommended Reference Books:

  • International Marketing by Philip R. Cateora

Semester 3 Subjects:

This semester focuses on global trade practices and legal aspects.

  • International Trade Regulations: Study regulations and treaties affecting international trade.
  • Foreign Direct Investment: Understand the role and impact of FDI in global business.
  • Global Business Ethics: Explore ethical issues and corporate social responsibility in international business.
  • International Negotiation and Conflict Resolution: Techniques for negotiation in a global context.
  • Global Market Research: Methods for conducting research in international markets.

Recommended Reference Books:

  • International Business Law and Its Environment by Richard Schaffer
  • Global Business and International Economics by G. M. P. H. Robinson

  • International Human Resource Management: Strategies for managing human resources globally.
  • Emerging Markets: Study business opportunities and challenges in emerging economies.
